They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. 

Sali, sitting in the middle in the photo, cultivates peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay plowing costs to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village, in Bougoula, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers. 

Sali expects to make a profit of 140,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Seneyiriwaton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SENEYIRIWATON 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAFECORE, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l‘arachide  avec  SALI , 1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à  BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 190.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "SENEYIRIWATON 2" are married women, who average 45 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in SAFECORE, a village in SANANKOROBA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with SALI, who is the first person sitting from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to maintain 1.5 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold at the village, in BOUGOULA, to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers. She plans on making a profit of 190,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Allamine Group

texts.fr:
ALLAMINE est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE qui regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et font de la restauration à l’image de KODIE  qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
KODIE, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans les activités de restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelque sacs de riz et des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, , choux,) pour des fins de restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
ALLAMINE is a group from the association BENKADI de TIELE. It comprises five women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 30 years of age and three children each, and they have different businesses, such as trading in condiments and working in food service, just like KODIE, who is in the second person standing from the left of the photo. They live in large traditional families in TIELE, in Préfecture de Kati (Région de SIKASSO, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are in high demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. They are on their seventh solidarity loan.
 
KODIE, who is the group's president, is well-known in TIELE and excels at food service. She intends to use her loan to purchase a few sacks of rice and some condiments of different kinds (black pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbage) for catering purposes. She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers. And she sells her food retail for cash or on credit to a customer base composed of men and women in TIELE. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA enabling her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food service

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDATON de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, sont mariées et mères en moyenne de cinq enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et d’habillements à l’image de BINTOU  au milieu de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
BINTOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de d’habillement. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagne wax et de bazin.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et vend ses articles à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group from the association SIGUIDATON de OUELESSEBOUGOU. It comprises five women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women are married mothers, who average 35 years of age and five children each. They have different businesses, such as trading in condiments and clothing, just like BINTOU, who is in the middle of the photo. They live in large traditional families in OUELESSEBOUGOU, in Préfecture de Kati (Région de SIKASSO, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are in high demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. They are on their fifth solidarity loan.
 
BINTOU, who is the group's president, is well-known in OUELESSEBOUGOU and excels at selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 lengths of Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and damask fabrics. She gets her supplies in Bamako, and she sells her goods retail for cash or on credit to a customer base composed of men and women in OUELESSEBOUGOU. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA enabling her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association MARIAMTON de KELEYA. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans,  six enfants et mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et des activités de  restauration à l’image de MAIMOUNA qui est la deuxième personne debout de gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KELEYA dans la  préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
MAIMOUNA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KELEYA, excelle dans la vente de galette. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de mil et des condiments pour sa restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à KELEYA et environnants  et vend ses galettes à KELEYA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
DJIGUIYA is a group from the association MARIAMTON de KELEYA. It comprises six women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 50 years of age and six children each, and they have different businesses, such as trading in condiments and working in food service, just like MAIMOUNA, who is the second person standing from the left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in KELEYA, in Préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de SIKASSO, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are in high demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program six years ago. They are on their ninth solidarity loan.
 
MAIMOUNA, who is the group's president, is well-known in KELEYA and excels at selling galettes. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 sacks of millet and some condiments for her catering service. She gets her supplies in and around KELEYA, and she sells her galettes retail for cash or on credit to a customer base composed of men and women in KELEYA. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA enabling her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making galettes

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Amparo del Socorro de 44 años de edad, casada, originaria del municipio de Chinandega  con tres hijos menores de edad que aún están a su cargo, dos de ellos están cursando sus estudios secundarios. Amparo tiene un negocio de mercadería en general, donde ofrece ropa de niños, damas y caballeros, prendas, cosméticos, ella su negocio, desde hace trece años, inicio este negocio  ofreciéndoles a compañeros de trabajos, ya que es reconocida por que se desempeña como enfermera en el hospital materno infantil en turnos nocturnos días de por medio que trabajan, clínicas y centros de salud,  tiene clientes fijo y eventuales, vende los diferentes productos al contado y de crédito, para abastecerse compra la mercadería de contado en Managua. Está solicitando financiamiento, para capital de trabajo, ya que necesita invertir más en el negocio, ya que tiene posee más cliente y tiene mayor demanda los productos que ofrece. Amparo  agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas ofrecen a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Amparo del Socorro is 44 years old, married, lives in the Chinandega municipality, and cares for her three young children. Two of her children are in secondary school.

Amparo owns a general store where she sells clothing for children, women, and men, garments, and cosmetics. She started her business three years ago. She began by offering clothes to her coworkers. She works the night shift in a women and children's hospital, and also works in clinics and health centers.

She has regular and occasional clients and sells her products for cash and credit. She purchases her merchandise in cash in Managua.

She requests the loan for working capital, since she needs to invest more in her business because she has more clients and a greater demand for the products that she offers.

Amparo is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with few economic resources.

loans.use: to obtain working capital and invest more in her clothing business.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 32-year-old married man from a small village near Jinen. He is the father of two children, a son and a daughter. Bassam works as an employee with a very low wage. This wage is not enough to cover all the needs of the family. Bassam would like to improve the family's living conditions by buying all the necessary home appliances and furniture. 

Bassam has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new living room furniture, which he could not buy with his small salary. 

Bassam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new living room furniture

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
This is Norberta. She previously accessed a PHP 15,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Norberta would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norberta dreams that her store will get bigger and hopes that her family will have good health. Weekly, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo. The photo was taken in their bridal store.

Haya is a 21-year-old married woman from a small village called Beta near Nablus city. Haya always dreamed of having a bridal dress shop. and maybe in the future opening a huge bridal center in the city. Haya and her brother started to work on this idea so they rented a small store in the city center. 

Haya took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a collection of Imported dresses, either to sell or to rent out. This is a very profitable project especially in the summer because the number of wedding parties increases. This project will improve living conditions for Haya and her family.

loans.use: to buy a collection of Imported dresses

loans.name: Actable The Best Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his late 50s, is married with eight children; three are in school and the rest are grown up and support themselves. Since the 1990s, Mohamed has been engaged in a charcoal-selling business. He started the project with a little capital, buying a few sacks of charcoal, but now his business has grown. Mohamed works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small profit per month.

This will be his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, both of which he repaid successfully, he restocked sacks of charcoal.  The profit received from the business was used to pay for school fees and home expenses. He will use this loan to restock sacks of charcoal. Mohamed thinks that one day he will be able to expand his project by stocking more charcoal so that he can manage greater customer demand.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Actable the Best, which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.en:
Baghdasar and his family live in the village, Geghamavan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. He has three nice children, two sons and a daughter. Baghdasar and his wife are devoted farmers and they perfectly manage their agricultural activities. 

On their farm they keep five cows, three calves, two bulls and twenty chickens. They work hard, and the milk that the cows give is of very high quality. They manage to deliver it to different points in neighboring villages, where various dairy product companies accept it in big wholesale quantities. They also cultivate potatoes, greens and beans. 

Baghdasar has taken loans from Nor Horizon eight times, and once from Kiva, so he has become very responsible and a good client. This time he is asking for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of animal fodder for the winter season and two calves in order to enlarge his animal breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a lot of animal fodder for the winter season and buy two calves in order to enlarge his animal breeding business.

loans.name: Zhirayr

texts.en:
Zhirayr and his small family live in the village of Geghamavan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Zhirayr has a vocational education, but he has always managed to find some work and take care of his family’s living conditions. He used to work as a technician-engineer at his village farm, and then he worked as an electrician in his village and has been content to do that work until now. 

Zhirayr is married and he has a son, who is now in military service. His wife is unemployed and together with him is engaged in farming and agriculture, which has become the main source of their family income. They own a plot of land, on which they cultivate potatoes and greens, and they also keep some farm animals: a cow, a calf, a piglet, two heifers and ten chickens. Zhirayr’s wife sells fresh milk, tasty cheese and eggs right from their house to the villagers. Their farm is a very small one, but they are doing their best to increase their income and to be able to enlarge the farm.

Zhirayr needs this loan amount to buy a lot of animal fodder. This is his first deal with Kiva lenders and he hopes very much that in the future, with the help of Kiva, he will also manage to enlarge his herd of animals.

loans.use: To buy a lot of animal fodder for the winter season

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Annah from Bulawayo. She is married and the couple are blessed with two children. The children are doing secondary education at a local school.  Annah runs a retail business selling various clothing items and footwear . The business has been in operation for over two years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of working capital, stiff competition from larger retailers, and high rentals for her premises. 

Annah has requested a loan of $500 to buy clothes and footwear for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay school fees for their children and improve the general welfare of the family. In the future Annah plans to open a boutique shop in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale

loans.name: Karla Cindia

texts.es:
Karla,  vive con su familia. Ella, posee una tienda y asimismo tiene una venta de pupusas para adquirir ingresos y con ello aportar para su familia. El  préstamo que  requiere le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y ampliarlo; este le servirá para comprar productos de la canasta básica tales como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, cereales, entre otros.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Karla live with her family. She has a shop and also sells pupusas, stuffed tortillas, for additional income to support her family. The loan she needs will strengthen and expand her business. She will buy household goods such as sugar, beans, rice, oil, and grains. She dreams of offering her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, grains, and more.

loans.name: José Félix

texts.es:
José tiene 69 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos; pero ya no viven con él solo un nieto que desde pequeño se los dejo una hija y él junto a su esposa lo han crecido. Es Empleado de profesión, tiene 30 años de trabajar como seguridad en una universidad nacional. Su nieto está estudiando en una Universidad la carrera de Ingeniería En sistemas, esta próximo a graduarse.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar los derechos de graduación de su nieto. Debido a que con lo que gana de seguridad no le ajusta para cubrir esos costos y su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa. 
Con el crédito, podrá ayudar a su nieto a culminar la carrera, ya que era un sueño para ambos.  Ahora su nieto podrá y tendrá la capacidad para trabajar y ayudar a sus abuelos que lo han apoyado en el transcurso de toda su carrera y defenderse pos si mismo.
texts.en:
José, 69, is married and has three independent children. However, his grandson, whom his daughter left in his care at an early age, lives with and has been raised by him and his wife. José has been working as a guard for the national university for 30 years. His grandson is studying systems engineering in college and is about to graduate. 

José has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to pay his grandson's graduation fees. His salary as a guard will not cover these expenses, and his wife  does housework. He will be able to help his grandson finish his degree, a dream they share, with this loan. His grandson now has the skills to work and help his grandparents, who have supported him during his studies and taught him how to support himself.

loans.use: to pay his grandson's graduation fees.

loans.name: Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid 20s, is married with two children, of whom one is in school and the remaining is still too young. For three years now, Hadija has been running different activities like selling clothes, liquid soap which she places in other shops, and  she also sells ice bars. She works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be Hadija's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania and she will use it to restock her inventory of clothes. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a big shop at the center of the city. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "MAFANIKIO" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her inventory of clothes.

loans.name: Rio Ypane Belen Group

texts.es:
8 de diciembre está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, COMUNIDAD DE PANCHITO LOPEZ la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. ROSALIA es una de las integrantes, ella es de una colonia pequeña en distrito de la ciudad Concepción PANCHITO LOPEZ donde tiene su pequeño negocio de Venta de frutas y verdura en el mercado y los fines de semana en la feria agrícola municipal. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras para la venta y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio y creciendo para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is from the community Pachito Lopez in the city of Concepción. The community is located quite far away from the central part of the city, and is still growing. The area is difficult to access, which is why the members of the group want to grow and help improving the environment of their community. The group is in its fifth loan cycle with the program.

One of the members is Rosalia, she is from a small settlement in the commuity Panchito Lopez and runs her small business selling fruits and vegetables in the market, and on weekends at the community's agricultural fair. 

Her wish is for her environment to improve with time and through the help of all the people in the area, so that it will be safer for their families and offer them a better future.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables, which she will sell in order to continue her business and make it grow so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables that she will sell

loans.name: Yiriwaton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Yiriwaton 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Darabougou. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Baoumou (première femme debout de la gauche vers la droite droite  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de  Darabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des petits équipements, des semences, et des intrants agricoles.  La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Yiriwaton 4" are married in traditional families, and they average 31 years of age and two children each, all living in the village of Darabougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, married, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing sundry equipment and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth farm loan cycle. 

Ms. Baoumou (first woman standing from the left in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Darabougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase some tools, seeds, and farm inputs. At the end of the harvest, the produce is sold for cash to pay back the loan and finally to have the revenues to support the children, as well as the family.

loans.use: to purchase sundry equipment, seeds, and farm inputs

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes du 1er quartier de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits, de condiments et de divers etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dix neuvième prêt de groupe. 
Rabiata  est un membre du groupe Danaya assise  au milieu devant ses articles à vendre.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter divers produits : charbon de bois et  du bois de chauffe. Elle se procure de ces articles à Koutiala et vend en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Rabiata compte réaliser  190 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the first district of Koutiala. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are married and average 40 years of age and four children each. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as clothing, condiments, and more. To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 19th group loan.

Rabiata is a member of the group Danaya. She is the one sitting in the middle with the items she sells. She intends to use her loan to purchase various products: charcoal and firewood. She procures these items in Koutiala and sells them retail for cash to a diverse customer base at the house and at the market.

While the other members of the group Danaya plan on making an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA each, over the course of this loan cycle, Ms. Rabiata plans on making 190,000 francs. In addition to repaying the loans, the women use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, such as firewood and charcoal, to sell

loans.name: Barrio La Cañada Group

texts.es: El grupo “Barrio La Cañada” está integrado por seis mujeres todas muy trabajadoras con muchas ganas de poder sobresalir en sus negocios y sacar adelante a su familia, se conocen desde hace ya varios años con el tiempo han llegado a construir una gran y sincera amistad. Ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua algunas personas aun se comunican en su lengua indígena, ya son muy pocas las mujeres que aun lucen sus trajes típicos caracterizados por sus colores muy llamativos. Algo muy característico de la comunidad donde se ubica el grupo es su pastizal muy verde y los hermosos paisajes de cerros muy frondosos. Adriana quien es integrante del grupo tiene 26 años de edad, solo estudio hasta la secundaria, se caracteriza por ser muy alegre siempre está de muy buen humor, vive en unión libre con su esposo Ángel quien trabaja como albañil, juntos han formado una familia con cinco niños de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando. Adriana tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace ya cuatro años. Esta vez está solicitando el crédito  para comprar más productos de abarrotes como pan, huevo, leche, refrescos, productos enlatados, etc.  Adriana  platica que inició la tienda de abarrotes porque donde donde vive no había tienda para adquirir algún producto. Ella platica que gracias al crédito ha podido mantener su tienda de abarrotes, procura tener siempre un poco de todo para así tener a sus clientes contentos con su servicio. El negocio de Adriana marcha muy bien, tiene buenas ganancias todos los días tiene ventas, su único inconveniente es la falta de su refrigerador, se lo descompusieron y por un buen rato no podrá vender refrescos fríos y productos lácteos. Ahora tendrá que ahorrar dinero para poder arreglar su refrigerador. Adriana espera no bajar sus ganancias porque su única ambición en la vida es llegar a tener una tienda más grande y a convertirla en una miscelánea. Adriana comento: “También deseo ayudar a mis niños a estudiar una carrera profesional para  mejorar su calidad de vida”. Los integrantes del grupo están agradecidos porque el crédito lo emplearán en sus actividades económicas lo que quizás les ayudara a aumentar sus ganancias y ampliar su negocio. Doña Irma y María Elsa invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes; Zenaida e Irene, en pollos y Carmen, en borregos.
texts.en:
The "Barrio La Canada" ( La Cañada district ) group is made up of six extremely hardworking women who all share the same determination to excel in their businesses and support their families.   They have known each other for a number of years and during this time they have built up a close and sincere friendship.  They live in a Mazahua community where some people still communicate in their native language.  Nowadays very few women still wear the typical local dress which is characterised by very bright colours.  Something very characteristic of the community where the group is based is its very green pasture land and the beautiful scenery of wooded hills.  

Adriana, who is 26, is one member of the group.  She was only educated to secondary level and is known for being very cheerful and always in a good mood.  She lives with Angel, who works as a bricklayer, and together they have built a family of five children, two of who are still in education.  Adriana has had a grocery shop for 4 years now.  She is seeking a loan to buy more groceries such as bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, tinned goods etc.  Adriana says that she set up the grocery shop because where she lives there was no shop to buy anything.  She says that the loan has enabled her to keep her grocery shop going; she always tries to stock a bit of everything so as to keep her customers happy.  Her shop is doing very well and she makes good profits as she makes sales every day.  Her only problem is the fact that she has no fridge because her previous one broke down, meaning that she will not be able to sell soft drinks or dairy products for a while.  She will now have to save up to pay for the fridge to be repaired.  Adriana hopes that her profits will not fall because her one ambition in life is to manage to get a bigger shop and turn it into a general store.

Adriana says: "I also want to help my children study for a professional career to improve their quality of life".

The members of the group are grateful because the loan will be useful for their economic activities and will perhaps help them increase their profits and extend their businesses.  Irma and María Elsa will invest in their grocery shops; Zenaida and Irene will invest in chickens; and Carmen will invest in sheep.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks, tinned goods etc.

location.town: San Jeronimo de los Dolores, San Felipe del Progre

loans.name: Gynna Patricia

texts.es:
GYNNA tiene 34 años de edad es soletera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Gynna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

Elm sueño es tener un regadío propio. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer ejercicios.
texts.en:
Gynna, 34, is single and has three children. She lives with her children in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank "Anchoveta," located in the Puerto Pechiche neighborhood of Anchoveta in Pueblo Viejo canton, and she is a farmer. 

Gynna grows corn and soybeans. She has applied for a loan to buy needed planting supplies: seed, manure, insecticide, and herbicide. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. She dreams of having her own irrigation. She likes to exercise in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, insecticide, and herbicide.

loans.name: Rosa Elsa

texts.es:
Rosa, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque menciona que los créditos son una herramienta muy importante para obtener buenas cosechas en la actividad agropecuaria; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas y mano de obra para limpiar la milpa.
Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, le ayudo a obtener cosechas libres de plagas para comercializar y para el consumo personal, asimismo obtuvo mas cerdos y adquirió mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa says that she needs a new loan because these loans have been a very important tool for her, helping her to get good harvests in her farming activities.  This investment will help her to buy agricultural supplies such as: fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides.  She will also use the loan to pay for labor to clear her maize fields.

Rosa's finances and her family's economic situation have improved.  She's been able to obtain harvests free of diseases to sell and to use for personal consumption.  Also, she acquired more pigs, and her earnings rose.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides, and to pay for workers

loans.name: Martha Gloria

texts.es:
La señora  Marta Gloria  de 34  años  de edad es casada,  vive con sus  cinco hijos en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña María Gloria vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, vende de todo y gracias a su actividad  ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña María Gloria está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, dulces, churros, pan, manteca, papel higiénico, mantequilla, leche, agua, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y salir adelante.
Doña María Gloria está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Marta Gloria, 34, is married and lives at home with her five children. She has owned a grocery store for six years. María Gloria sells all kinds of household goods and is hardworking and enterprising. She wants to be successful and offers many items. Thanks to her business, she has been able to support her children and now wants to increase her income.

María Gloria has applied for a loan to buy produce, candy, churros, bread, shortening, toilet paper, butter, milk, water, and more for her business so that she can earn more and get ahead. María Gloria is pleased to be working with Prisma, and she dreams of expanding her business and renovating her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to buy produce, candy, churros, bread, shortening, toilet paper, butter, milk, water, and more for her business.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento de su negocio y para crecer aun más; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar salchichas, pan francés, jugos, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, las condiciones económicas  se han optimizado,  ya que le permitió mejorar las ganancias y satisfacción de los clientes; hoy en día sus hijos llevan más dinero a la escuela.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan to strengthen and grow her business.  This investment will help her to buy sausages, French bread, juices, and other items.  

She had a good result with her previous loan.  Her financial situation improved, because with the loan her earnings increased and so did her customer's satisfaction.  Now her children can have more money for school.

loans.use: to buy sausages, French bread, juices, and other products

loans.name: Gulbubu

texts.ru: Гулбубу, 32 года, мать троих детей, дети все маленькие. Гулбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и терпению Гулбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы и 6 овец, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития соего хозяйства и увеличения поголовья скота, Гулбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25 000 сом (KGS) на покупку мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Гулбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого бизнеса, а также хочет материально улучшить благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulbubu is 32 years old and a mother of three small children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Gulbubu has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for ten years, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work and patience, today her business contains two dairy cows and six sheep, and the monthly profit from the business amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).   In order to further develop her business and increase livestock headcount, Gulbubu requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy small livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business and also wants to improve the family's financial wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Altyngul

texts.ru: Алтынгул, 52 года, замужем, мать-героиня, имеет 6 детей (2 дочери и 4 сына). Разведением скота начала заниматься более 30 лет назад. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Основным источником дохода ее семьи является животноводство. На сегодняшний день благодаря ее упорству, целеустремленности и помощи ее семьи развела небольшое хозяйство: 4 коровы и 2 лошади. Алтынгул хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота и, в связи с этим, обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Алтынгул входит в состав группы "МОЛ", в которой участвуют еще 2 человека кроме нее. На доходы от кредита Алтынгул хочет расширить и приумножить скот в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Altyngul is 52 years old, married and a mother-hero - she has six children (two daughters and four sons).  She got involved in breeding livestock over 30 years ago.  Her husband and children help with the business.  Animal husbandry provides the primary source of income for her family.  To-date, thanks to her persistence and drive, and help from her family, she was able to develop a small business, containing four cows and two horses.  Altyngul wants to continue increasing the livestock headcount and, for this purpose, requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cattle.  Altyngul is part of the "MOL" group that has two more participants besides her.  Altyngul wants to use the earnings from the loan to expand her business and increase livestock quantities on her farm.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 41 years old, from the Akhmeta district of East Georgia. She lives with her son and retired mother. Nino’s husband lives abroad so Nino heads the family and is involved in dairy farming with two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Her main economic activity is the newly-started café, where 'doner' (fast food sandwiches) and various of beverages are sold. Her project is profitable but it needs support for further development.

Nino decided to expand her fast food business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfied their requirements. 

Nino received this credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, so called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 2000 Gel, she will purchase inventory such as a display refrigerator, chairs and tables to expand her activities. 

Summertime is the high season for the café business and Nino believes that the project will be lucrative. Her regular customers will be locals and passersby as well.  Nino will serve her clients herself and work hard to increase turnover gradually. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her newly-started cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a set of tires for her taxi as well as clothing, bed sheets, and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Astor

texts.en:
Astor wants to rebuild an animal stable with this loan and he is already thrilled by the fact that has been selected as a beneficiary of the Value Chain Projects, a collaboration effort between World Vision Albania, VisionFund Albania and Kiva.

"I had applied for loans to almost all financial institutions, but they had rejected me due to the lack of collateral and/or income," is what he said to the loan officer who interviewed him.

Astor is 35 and married. He has three children whose ages range between eight and two. They live in a village in the southeastern part of the country where the lives of the residents are not easy at all. The winters are extremely cold and snowy and their plants most of the times are damaged by severe snowstorms and frosts..

loans.use: to rebuild a damaged animal stable

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
A group comprised of six enterprising women with a great deal of creativity for business - such are the members of the "Yehowa Akwe" group. They are into the sales of plastic products, plates, cups, slippers, fish, scarves and cosmetics.

Gifty is 35 years old and married, and has three children. For the past fifteen years she has been selling used plastic products, plates, cups and cooking utensils, walking door-to-door to customers with the goal of getting ahead. Gifty reports that with a great deal of effort and hard work she has generated profits in order to cover her household expenses. In the future she'd like to own a small store of her own where she can sell her plastic products, plates, cups, and cooking utensils and thus increase her profits. With the loan of GHS 1500 she'll purchase more plastic products, plates, cups, and cooking utensils and therefore she'll be able to improve her earnings.
 
The group is grateful to Kiva for the extension of help to 'Yehowa Akwe'.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic products, plates, cups, and cooking utensils

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa, a 43-year-old married father of three, earns a living as an electrical welder, his family's main source of income; his wife stays at home to care for the house and children.

As an employee of a private company, Isa receives a very low monthly salary and is planning to open his own welding company, working on a freelance basis with multiple projects. From his previous experience working for other companies he has developed many relationships and acquired many clients whom he is planning to work with and for.

Isa is requesting a loan in order to purchase a welding machine and other working tools, as he needs equipment to build a good business reputation and to satisfy his customers. With his income, he will be able to help his family with all of their expenses.

Isa is very ambitious and he intends to work very hard to enhance the family’s standard of living and meet their needs. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine and other working tools.

loans.name: Jaloliddin

texts.ru: Чалолиддин занимается торговым бизнесом в городе Вахдат, расположенный в 20 километрах от места его проживания -  города Душанбе. У него большая семья. Он женат и отец четверых дочерей и одного сына. Ему 34 года. Он в торговом центре города Вахдат арендует магазин, где занимается продажей продуктов питания. В частности он продает масло, макарон, чай, сахар, печенье, вафли, прохладительные напитки и т.д., а также из хозяйственных товаров шампунь, мыло, стиральный порошок, зубная паста, детские влажные салфетки. Чалолиддин занимается торговым бизнесом уже 10 лет. Он обслуживает покупателей качественно и вежливо, и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. В данный момент Чалолиддин хочет увеличить товарооборот. Он просит кредит для приобретения разнообразного ассортимента продуктов питания.
texts.en: Jaloliddin is involved in a retail business in the city of Vahdat, located 20 kilometers from his place of residence - the city of Dushanbe.  He has a large family.  He is married and a father of four daughters and one son.  He is 34 years old.  He leases a store in a shopping center in Vahdat, where he is involved in selling food products.  He sells oil, pasta, tea, sugar, cookies, waffles, refreshing beverages, etc., and also household products like shampoo, soap, laundry detergent, toothpaste and children's wet wipes.  Jaloliddin has been involved in the retail business for ten years.  He serves customers with quality and respect, and has regular clients.  Currently, Jaloliddin wants to increase goods turnover.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of food products.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products in order to expand his business

loans.name: Yiriwaton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Yiriwaton 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Darabougou. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Aminata (deuxième  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de  Darabougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des petits équipements, des semences, et des intrants agricoles. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Yiriwaton 1" are married in traditional families, and they average 39 years of age and two children each, all living in the village of Darabougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, married, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing sundry equipment and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth farm loan cycle. 

Ms. Aminata (second woman standing from the left in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Darabougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase some tools, seeds, and farm inputs. At the end of the season, the produce is sold for cash to pay back the loan and finally to have the revenues to support the children, as well as the family.

loans.use: to purchase sundry equipment, seeds, and farm inputs

loans.name: Yiriwaton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Yiriwaton 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 2 enfants. Madame  Belko (dernière femme debout à droite avec la calebasse en main dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de  Darabougou. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.

loans.use: to purchase sundry equipment, seeds, and farm inputs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a very quiet neighborhood in Rafah city. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector and does not have a high income. His job is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad would like to improve the conditions of his house and buy all the necessary items that his family needs. 
Mohammad took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator. This is very necessary to keep food cold, especially in Rafah, which is a very hot city. 
Mohammad would like to take out another loan in the future to purchase other necessary home appliances that his family needs. 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for the family home

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Jema is in her early 30s, married, and has one child who attends school. For two years, she has been managing her family by running a shop selling body sprays, woman bags, body lotions, and Muslim type of dresses (madera in Swahili). Jema works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily and is able to make very good returns each month. 

Jema is requesting her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  With her previous loans all of which she paid back successfully, she bought more woman bags, body sprays, and lotions. Jema recently opened a permanent business premise where she sells her items.  With the business profit, she  pays school fees and household expenses and reinvests in the business. She will use this loan to buy more Muslim type of dresses and body sprays. Jema hopes that one day will be able to expand her business. 

Jema will share this loan with her loan group, Wega, which consists 11 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more Muslim type of dresses and body sprays.

loans.name: Gnongondeme Ton I Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  Gnongondeme ton I sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 7enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Koumbri, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs  avec Yaya, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1.5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser  un bénéfice moyen de 200.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Gnongondeme Ton I group are married men, who average 50 years of age with seven children each and who all live in traditional families in Koumbri, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region.

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of carrying out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and the previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Yaya, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows corn. With his loan he is planning to buy fertilizers, seeds and small farming materials, as well as to pay labor costs to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. 

Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a customer base made up of men and women.

Yaya expects to make an average 200,000FCFA profit at the end of the season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also help out with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, farming equipment and hoeing.

loans.name: Gnongondeme Ton Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Gnongondeme ton II sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Koumbri, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs  avec Karim, 3 ème debout au milieux  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Gnongondeme Ton Ii group are married men, who average 45 years of age with seven children each and who all live in traditional families in Koumbri, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region.

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of carrying out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and the previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Karim, who is standing in the middle of the photo, grows corn. With his loan he is planning to buy fertilizers, seeds and small farming materials, as well as to pay labor costs to maintain 1 hectare of land. 

Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a customer base made up of men and women.

Karim expects to make an average 150,000FCFA profit at the end of the season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also help out with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, farming equipment and hoeing.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia de 31  años  de edad vive con esposo y sus  tres hijos en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 05  años  a la  venta de ropa nueva, usada y calzado.
Doña Sonia es muy amable y por tal razón sus clientes le prefieren, también por su buen trato, por su variedad de productos y los  buenos precios,  su venta es de manera ambulante y en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Sonia está solicitando el préstamo para comprar cemento, cerámica y mano de obra materiales que necesita para mejorar el  piso de su casa, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a home of their own. She has been selling new and used clothing, as well as shoes, for five years.

Doña Sonia is extremely friendly, which is why her customers prefer to do business with her. She also provides good service and a variety of products at good prices. Sonia conducts her sales as a street vendor and from her home. She is a hardworking woman who wants to succeed.

Doña Sonia is requesting a loan so that she can buy cement and ceramic tiles, and also pay for labor. She needs to pay these expenses so that she can improve the floor of her house. Sonia is very pleased to be continuing as a client with Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2013

loans.use: to repair the floor of her house by purchasing cement, ceramic tiles, and paying for labor.

loans.name: Maria Mirtalina

texts.es:
La  señora  María de 51 años  de edad, vive en  su casa  con un hijo  que depende de ella, es una madre soltera que lucha para sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica desde hace 07  años a la venta de tortillas.
Doña María realiza  sus ventas  desde su casa y sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad los cuales le prefieren por su atención y buen trato. 
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  maíz, leña y cal que son la materia prima para elaborar las tortillas, su deseo es comprar al por mayor ya que necesita tener suficiente producto para de esta manera, obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña María su sueño es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Maria, 51, lives in her house with one child, who is a dependent.  She is a single mother who strives to provide for her family.  For 7 years, she has been selling tortillas.

Maria makes her sales from her house.  Her customers are her friends and neighbors who prefer her because of her attentive service.  

Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime, which are the raw materials used to make tortillas.  She wants to make her purchases at wholesale, because with sufficient products, she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Maria's dream is to improve her house.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her business

loans.name: Kelsinbubu

texts.ru: Келсинбубу, 54 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей (2 дочери и 2 сына). Образование-высшее. С 1993 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15 000 сом (KGS). Келсинбубу имеет очень хорошую практику в разведении скота и обработки земли. Супруг подрабатывает на стройке-частным строителем. Оплата сдельная. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Келсинбубу составляет 5000  сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и активной помощи супруга, Келсинбубу на сегодняшний день имеет небольшое  хозяйство: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок. Также в наличии имеет 4,0 ГА поливной земли, где ежегодно сажает фасоль, которая приносит очень хороший урожай. Прибыль позволила Келсинбубу размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего увеличения скота в домашнем хозяйстве, Келсинбубу обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Келсинбубу  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем хочет достроить свой дом.
texts.en: Kelsinbubu is 54, married, and has four children (two sons and two daughters). She has a college education and has been a farmer since 1993. She started her business with 15,000 som and is skilled at planting crops and raising livestock. Her spouse does part-time piecework on a private builder's construction site. Thanks to her hard work and active help from her spouse, Kensinbubu currently runs a small farm with one milk cow, one bull, and four hectares of irrigated land where she plants beans and yields a very good harvest. She earns 5,000 som per month from her business and uses the money to breed cattle and improve the family's situation. In order to increase the number of her livestock, Kelsinbubu asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som to purchase additional cattle. Kelsinbubu plans to continue to increase her herds and in the future wants to use her additional profits to build an addition on her home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: José Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 35 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 12 años respectivamente. Es Empleado de profesión, tiene 13 años de trabajar como ordenanza. Además,  posee una pequeña tienda en su casa la cual administra su compañera de vida.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar churros, galletas, granos básicos, jabón, lejía y entre otros productos para surtir su tienda de productos que están demandando los clientes y la otra mitad los utilizara en la construcción de un muro el cual protegerá la vivienda de una cárcava que se hace en la época de lluvias.
Al poseer mayor cantidad de productos aumentaran las ventas y por ende los ingresos los cuales beneficiaran a toda su familia; ya no tendrá el problema con las aguas lluvias lo que también traerá bienestar a la familia.
Sus metas es continuar, aumentando los productos de la tienda y que algún día se pueda tener todos los productos que los clientes necesitan, seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de mi familia.
texts.en:
José, 35, lives with his life partner and two children, ages 7 and 12. He has been employed for 13 years and also operates a small shop with his partner. He has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy churros, cookies, grains, soap, bleach and other products his customers want to stock his store; he will use the other half to build a wall to protect his house from flooding. 

The additional inventory will increase sales and income, which will help the entire family. They will no longer have to worry about flooding, which will improve the family's well-being. His goals are to keep going and stocking more inventory so that one day he will have everything his customers want. He also wants to keep improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy churros, cookies, grains, soap, bleach and other products his customers want to stock his store. He will use the other half to build a  wall to protect his house from flooding.

loans.name: Luís Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y procreo tres hijos; pero solo vive con él una hija. Es comerciante de profesión, tiene 15 años de trabajar como vendedor ambulante (en la calle) de agua, gaseosas, churros, sorbetes, entre otros productos consumibles. Él le ayuda a su esposa, ya que ella se encarga de administrar una cafetería en donde venden distintos productos como: agua, gaseosas, churros, sorbetes. Ella lo hace en el establecimiento y él en la calle para vender más.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar un crédito que tiene con otra institución, el cual solicito para surtir el negocio, pero por los intereses que paga en ese banco no le queda ganancia y por eso decidió mejor hacer el trámite con Fundación Campo. De esta forma, pretende ver ganancias en su negocio mejorando el negocio y las condiciones familiares, ya que ahora los intereses que tendrá que pagar serán menores y recibirá mejor trato de parte de Fundación Campo.
texts.en:
Luis, 51, is married and has 3 children, but only one daughter lives with him.  He is a merchant by profession; he has worked for 15 years as a street vendor, selling water, soft drinks, churros, sorbets, and other food items.  His wife helps him with the business; she is in charge of managing a cafe where they sell a variety of products such as water, soft drinks, churros, and sorbets. She sells from their cafe, and he sells in the street so that they can sell more.

Luis is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo to pay off a loan that he has with another institution, which he used to stock up his business.  Because of the high interest rate that he is paying the bank, he is left with no profits, and so this is why he decided to get a better loan with Fundacion Campo.  In this way he expects to see the profits from his business improve.  His family's financial situation will improve, because now the interest that he will have to pay will be less, and he will receive better treatment from Fundacion Campo.

loans.use: to pay off a loan that he has with another institution

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, está casado, tiene la edad de 33 años, vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va compra los repuestos para arreglar una maquinaria que tiene varada. El trabaja con maquinaria pesada realizando trabajos y sacando madera y su maquinaria sufrió un desperfecto mecánico y necesita arreglar pues es su forma de ganarse el sustento. El espera poder arreglarla rápido y con esta mejorar su maquinaria quedara trabajando  en mejores condiciones y así también podrá aumentar su trabajo y sacar mas provecho aumentando sus ganancias y generando su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ronald is married, 33 years old and he lives with his wife and 2 children, who are his top priority. With the credit he is asking for, he will purchase replacement parts to fix machinery that has stopped working. He works with heavy machinery doing jobs and cutting wood. His machinery has suffered from having been worked on by an unskilled mechanic and Ronald needs to fix it because this is how he earns a living. He hopes he will be able to fix everything quickly and with his improved machinery he can continue working in better condition and also be able to increase his labor load so that he can earn even more money and give his family a good place to live. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans with any state banks, but FUDECOSUR will be able to offer him a loan more easily and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: purchase replacement parts for his machinery.

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Файзали 24 года. Он недавно женился и проживает со своей женой у родителей в городе Вахдат. Файзали зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь торговым бизнесом. Он в течении 3-х лет занимается продажей сим карты мобильных компаний, а также аксессуаров мобильных телефонов, в частности панели, аккумуляторные батареи, зарядные устройства, наушники, USB-флэшки и т.д. Файзали на рынке города арендует магазин, где осуществляет свою деятельность. Сейчас Файзали необходимо увеличить товарооборот. Он запрашивает кредит в размере 2000 долларов США, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Файзали обещает выплачивать кредит в срок и ждет вашей поддержки.
texts.en: Faizali is 24 years old.  He recently got married and lives with his wife with his parents in the city of Vahdat.  Faizali earns a living by being involved in a retail business.  He has been selling mobile companies SIM cards and also mobile phone accessories, such as panels, power batteries, charging equipment, headphones, USB flash cards, etc., for three years.  Faizali leases a store in the city market, where he runs his business.  Now, Faizali needs to increase his goods turnover.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars to increase goods turnover.  Faizali promises to repay the loan on-time and awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and SIM cards for resale in order to grow his business

loans.name: Gnongondeme Ton Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Gnongondeme ton III sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Koumbri, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs  avec Seydou, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Gnongondeme Ton Iii group are married men, who average 42 years of age with six children each and who all live in traditional families in Koumbri, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region.

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of carrying out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and the previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Seydou, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows corn. With his loan he is planning to buy fertilizers, seeds and small farming materials, as well as to pay labor costs to maintain 1 hectare of land. 

Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a customer base made up of men and women.

Seydou expects to make an average 150,000FCFA profit at the end of the season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also help out with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor, fertilizers, farming equipment and hoeing.

loans.name: Tiessiri (Le Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Tiessiri est un regroupement de femmes du 1er quartier de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits de la restauration, et des articles divers. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. 
Tata, 3 eme de la droite vers la  gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des poulets, de la viande de mouton et de bœuf pour les préparer et vendre. Elle se procure de ces aliments  au grand marché. Elle vend en détail et au comptant à la maison qui fait d’ailleurs face au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Mme Tata compte réaliser  180 000FCFA au cours de cycle.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Tiessiri is a group of women from Koutiala's first district, who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 39 years of age, are married and have on average two children each.

This group of women trade in a variety of products such as clothing, restauration and others. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fourth group loan.

Tata, who is standing third from the right on the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy chickens, mutton and beef to make up into meals and sell. She gets her food from the Grand Market and sells on a retail basis and for cash from her home, which lies opposite the market, to a diverse customer base.

Tata expects to make 180,000FCFA during the season. As well as repaying their loans, the women use part of their income to cover personal expenses and expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration business.

loans.name: Nasipkan

texts.ru: Насипкан, 48 лет, замужем, многодетная мать, имеет 5 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. Насипкан на протяжении 18 лет занимается разведением скота, параллельно занимается полеводством. Насипкан имеет не только практический опыт, но и теоретические навыки в разведении скота. Она с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 0,45 ГА земли, выращивает кукурузу. Дети помогают по хозяйству. Супруг находится в России на заработках. На сегодняшний день благодаря своему упорству и целеустремленности, Насипкан развела небольшое хозяйство: 5 овец, 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 6 коз. Насипкан хочет и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота, в связи с этим, обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Насипкан входит в состав группы "МОЛ", в которой участвуют еще 2 человека кроме нее. На доходы от кредита Насипкан планирует улучшить условия для содержания скота.
texts.en: Nasipkan is 48 years old, married and a mother with many children - she has five children of school and preschool age.  Nasipkan has been involved in breeding livestock for 18 years and is concurrently involved in farming.  Nasipkan has not only practical experience, but also theoretical know-how in breeding livestock.  She treats her business with a lot of responsibility.  She annually works on 0.45 hectares of land and grows corn.  The children help with the business.  Her husband works in Russia.  To-date, thanks to her persistence and drive, Nasipkan developed a small business, containing five sheep, one dairy cow, one calf and six goats.  Nasipkan wants to continue increasing the livestock headcount and, for this purpose, requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cattle.  Nasipkan is part of the "MOL" group that has two more participants besides her.  Nasipkan plans to use the earnings from the loan to improve the conditions for keeping livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Bazarkan

texts.ru: Базаркан, 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 взрослых детей. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Разведением скота начала заниматься более 20 лет назад, начав с суммы в 10000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности развела небольшое хозяйство: 5 овец, 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь. Базаркан хочет и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота, в связи с этим, обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 60000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Базаркан входит в состав группы "МОЛ", в которой участвуют еще 2 человека кроме нее. На доходы от кредита Базаркан планирует расширить хозяйство и  улучшить благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Bazarkan is 40 years old, married and has four grown children.  Her husband and children help with the business.  She got involved in breeding livestock over 20 years ago, having started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  To-date, thanks to her persistence and drive, she developed a small business, containing five sheep, two dairy cows, one calf and one horse.  Bazarkan wants to continue increasing the livestock headcount and, for this purpose, requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cattle.  Bazarkan is part of the "MOL" group that has two more participants besides her.  Bazarkan plans to use the earnings from the loan to expand her business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Majd

texts.en: Majd is 21 years old, single and lives a village near Ramallah. He is in his third year of college studying political science. He also runs an Internet cafe in the village; it works very will and earns a good income. Majd would like to improve the cafe by updating the programs for his computers and do some decorations which will make his business more attractive. His goal is to earn more money by attracting more customers.

loans.use: to develop his Internet cafe by updating his PC and doing some decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, coffee, sugar, beer, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Mihrije

texts.en:
