Mihrije is 26, married, and has four children between the ages of 1 and 9 years old. They all live in a minority Roma community in Kosovo. 

Mihrije is a housewife and a stay-at-home mother, while her husband, who is the main source of the family's income, works in a shop market. 

This loving family lives in unacceptable conditions. They live in a small old house, which has a serious problem with its insulation and the windows and doors. This means that, during the rainy season and wintertime, they experience minor flooding, poor heat retention, drafts, and increased utility bills. 

Mihrije is requesting a loan to buy windows and door frames for her house, with the hopes that it will improve the living conditions for her family. Mihrije is grateful to all Kiva lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy windows and door frames for her house.

loans.name: Zejnije

texts.en: Zejnije is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are 4 and 9 years old. She and her husband are not currently working so the family's main source of income comes from her husband parents, brother and sister, all of whom live in other European countries. The family members send them money each month to pay for the family’s needs. Zejnije is planning to renovate her house, adding an additional area that she will use as a small store so that in the future she will be able to open her own business. She is requesting this loan to build the shop. At the moment she has not decided what kind of business she will start. She is hoping in the future to have her own income and not rely on other family members to provide for her family. Her goal is to have a better life and to become financially independent. She is very glad to have this opportunity and appreciates Kiva lenders for their help!

loans.use: to build a shop in her home.

loans.name: Yaqoup

texts.en: Yaqoub is a 52 years old, married and lives in Albeireh, near Ramallah city. He owns a fruit and vegetable store, is well known and has many customers. His wife works as an employee. Yaqoup has taken out a USD loan from FATEN to help him to develop his store by expanding it and buying more refrigerators for storing frozen food. This will increase his income. We see him here while working in his store.

loans.use: to develop his store by expanding it and buying more refrigerators.

loans.name: Jarri Alexis

texts.es:
El joven Jarri de 25 años de edad es soltero vive en casa de su madre, en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de achinería.
Jarri en su motocicleta se desplaza todo los días por las mañanas a diferentes barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y lugares  aledaños para ofrecer sus productos, sus clientes le prefieren por amabilidad y buen trato.
Jarri  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de juguetes, blusas, cremas, ganchos de pelo, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende suplir la necesidad  de financiamiento para surtir su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Jarri su sueño es  tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Jarri is a young man who is 25-years old.  He is single and lives at home with his mother in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  For the last three years he had made his living selling low-cost consumer goods.
Every morning, Jarri goes out on his motorbike to the different neighborhoods and out-lying areas of San Lorenzo and nearby areas to sell his merchandise.  His customers like to buy from him because he is friendly and treats them well. 
Jarri is requesting the loan in order to purchase toys, blouses, lotions, hair clips etc.  With the help of the loan, he will have the financing he needs to stock up his business and improve his quality of life.  
Jarri's dream to to have his own house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2013.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, lotions, hair clips etc. for his business.

loans.name: Villa Rayanniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa ella es casada y tiene 34 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría cuyes y también la socia se dedica a la ganaderia,la socia en sus negocios ya lleva 2 años y le va muy bien, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, , el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los animales.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despúes la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de verduras y negocio de crianza de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank in the Taray district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Luisa, a member, is 34 years old, married, and has four children.  She works in her business of raising animals.  She raises guinea pigs and also works with livestock.  She has had her businesses for two years, and it is going very well for her.  She fattens her animals and helps them grow.  She then sells them at the different fairs.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell the animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for the animals.

The member in the photo that is inset asked permission for her photo to be taken afterwords for work reasons.

The members sell basic grains, sell food, sell vegetables, and raise animals.

The member is grateful to those who comprise part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Vital

texts.es: Vital, está casado, tiene la edad de 47 años, vive con su esposa e hijo que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su maíz. El tiene pensado comprar el abono, plaguicidas y fumigaciones necesarias para mantener su cultivo en óptimas condiciones para la producción. El espera con esta mejora poder aumentar la producción de su plantación y así poder aumentar ganancias económicas. El espera poder mejor su calidad de vida de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Vital, age 47, is married.  He lives with his wife and child, and they are his greatest priority.  He will use the loan to buy supplies to help care for his corn.  He plans to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and fumigation products, which are needed to keep his crop in optimal condition for production.  

He hopes, with this improvement, to be able to increase his production and, in this way, to increase his earnings.  He hopes to be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies to help care for his corn crop.

loans.name: Saul David

texts.es:
Saul tiene 51 años de estado civil casado tiene 5 hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios. 

Es integrante a la Ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas. 

Saul se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, soya, las compras las realiza en ventanas y las realiza en la ciudad de ventanas. El credito solicita para la compra de semillas, urea, fertilizantres, herbicidas.

El credito le ayudado para comprar lo que le hace falta para la agricultura. El sueño es tener un propio regadio para los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafios como la competencia y el mal clima. En los tiempos le gusta hacer deporte es especial indor.
texts.en:
Saul is 51 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his wife and children in the canton of Pueblo Viejo in Los Ríos Province.

Saul is a member of the Communal Bank “Anchoveta”, which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the precinct of Anchoveta, canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members engage in farm work.

Saul is a farmer who grows corn and soybeans. His purchases are conducted in Ventanas. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and herbicides. By obtaining this loan, he will be able to acquire what he lacks for farming. His dream is to have his own plot of irrigable land for his crops. The challenges he faces include dealing with the competition and bad weather.

In his free time, Saul enjoys playing sports such as indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and herbicides.

loans.name: Muharrem

texts.en: Muharrem lives in the southwestern part of Kosovo. He is married, 39 years old, and the father of four children. His wife stays at home to care for their children while he works as a driving school instructor.  He is a very hard worker and is trying to improve the living conditions for his family. Muharrem has had a longstanding problem with his toilet because it has not been repaired in the past several years. He could not manage to save the money to do a renovation, and so is requesting a loan to do the repairs and correct an unsanitary and unhealthy condition. He is very grateful for this opportunity to improve his family's life and appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate his toilet.

loans.name: José Nicolas

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. Es jornalero de profesión, tiene un aproximado de 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura, inicio el trabajo por iniciativa propia; ya que sabe trabajar como ayudante de albañil, pero cuando no encuentra trabajo cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, fertilizante, plaguicidas, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. De esta manera, adquirirá todos los insumos que necesita de una sola vez y a un mejor precio en el momento oportuno. 
Con la siembra del maíz, está asegurando una cosecha la cual le servirá para consumo de su familia (tortillas) y otra parte para la venta la cual le generara ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades en el hogar. Entre sus planes, esta en  primer lugar  obtener una buena cosecha, la cual le genere los suficientes ingresos para cancelar la cuenta pendiente con Fundación Campo; la cual le a brindado el soporte económico.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old and lives with his life partner and their two children aged 10 and 12. He works as a day laborer and has approximately 10 years of experience working in agriculture, an activity he has initiated on his own initiative. He knows how to work as a bricklayer's assistant, but when he can't find jobs he cultivates 7.000 square meters of corn.

The loan he is applying for at Fundación Campo is for buying seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for cultivating his 7.000 square meters of corn. That way, he can buy all the inputs he needs at once and at the right timing so that he gets a better price.

By sowing corn he is ensuring a harvest that will provide his family with food (tortillas), and he will sell a part in order to generate incomes to cover other household expenses. His main priority is to get a good harvest that generates enough income to pay back the loan he has with Fundación Campo, which has offered him financial support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for cultivating his 7.000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Mouniou Group

texts.fr:
Mouniou est un regroupement de femmes du quartier  Médina Coura de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits, des condiments, de la restauration et des articles divers. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. 
Fatoumata  qui est la 1 ère assise de la gauche vers la droite,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de sucre de lait et autres ingrédients  pour la confection de bonbon de toute sorte. Elle s’approvisionne à  Koutiala et  vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Mouniou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme   Fatoumata compte réaliser  150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Mouniou is a group of women from the Médina Coura neighborhood of the city of Koutiala. The members of the group are married women who know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are, on average, 36 years old with five children each.

This group of women sells various goods such as clothes, condiments, meals and other various items.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are now on their fifth group loan.

Fatoumata, first from the left in the front row, plans to use her loan to buy some bags of condensed milk and other ingredients to make various sweets.  She buys her supplies in Koutiala and resells her goods for cash, on a retail basis. She sells from home and at the market to a diverse group of customers.

While the other members of the Mouniou group are each expecting to make an average profit of 125,000 CFA francs during this loan cycle, Fatoumata is expecting to make 150,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying their loans, the members of the group will use part of their earnings to meet personal expenses and increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make various sweets.

loans.name: La Libertad 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es soltera de 21 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a bordar guipiles típicos, inició este negocio por la enseñanza de su madre y hasta la fehca lleva 3 años de experiencia, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos y telas para poder bordar guipiles de diferentes estilos y colores, en el futuro cercano desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender los guipiles que borda y con el préstamo que le concederán lo podra lograr; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a bordar, tejer y a sastrería.
texts.en:
Sra. Micaela is single and 21 years of age. She did not have the opportunity to study. Micaela embroiders traditional garments. She started her business after learning this skill from her mother. As of now, she has three years of experience. Micaela has the support of her family.

She organized a group so that she could request a loan. The money will be used to buy thread and fabrics for making embroidered garments of different styles and colors. In the near future, she hopes to have a store where she can sell traditional embroidered garments. As a result of the loan, she hopes to achieve this goal.

The other members of the group engage in embroidery, weaving, and tailoring.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for making traditional embroidered garments.

loans.name: Marlit

texts.es:
La señora  Marlit  de 29  años  de edad es soltera  vive con sus  dos hijos en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 02 años   al negocio de venta de ropa americana su venta la realiza de forma ambulante y en su casa.
Doña Marlit  su negocio está  ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en su negocio  vende todo lo relacionado  a la venta de ropa nueva y usada y también vende enchape que es joyas de plata y acero.
Doña Marlit es una mujer joven y muy bien trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Marlit está solicitando el préstamo para compra de faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas, blusas, calzonetas, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar un poco sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Marlit su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Marlit is 29 years old. She is single and lives with her two children in her home. For two years she has worked in the business of selling American clothes as a street vendor and in her house. 

Marlit's business is located in the community of  San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. In her business she sells all kinds of clothes, both used and new. She also sells "enchape", which is silver and steel jewelry. Marlit is a young woman who is very hardworking and who wants to get ahead. 

Marlit is asking for the loan to buy skirts, pants, dresses, shorts, blouses, swim shorts, etc. With the help of the loan she intends to improve her income a little and therefore her quality of life. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.

Marlit's dream is to improve her home and her business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, blouses, swim shorts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier, está en unión libre, tiene la edad de 27 años, y actualmente vive  con su esposa e hijos. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su plantación de maíz. El va comprar los insumos como abonos, plaguicidas y todas las fumigaciones necesarias. El espera con todo esto mejorar su plantación en tenerla en condiciones optimas para la cosecha y así obtener mayores producciones que lo años anteriores. El espera poder vender su cosecha a un muy bien precio y salir adelante con los pagos de su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia como prioridad   Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Javier, 27, is in a common law relationship and currently living with his wife and children.  He will use the loan to buy supplies for his corn crop.  He will buy supplies like manure, insecticides and all necessary fumigations.  

He hopes with all this to improve his plantation and keep it in optimum conditions for harvest so that crop yields will be better than in years past.  He hopes to sell his harvest at a very good price to continue making his loan payments and to improve his family’s quality of life as a priority.

This is his second loan from Fudecosur.  He’d had not previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur has offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es: Aniceta vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 65 años de edad y tiene siete hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, refrescos, verduras, carnes, gaseosas y otras cosas más, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos y esta implementada con la cosas básicas, ella a tiende a sus vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Aniceta lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo in Cusco Department.  She’s 65-years-old and is raising seven children.  She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, soft-drinks, vegetables, meats, snacks and other things in a small store she has at home where she sells her goods; it’s stocked with the basics.  She tends to her neighbors and friends very kindly and courteously which is why they always return to buy.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She’s a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar to add to her business capital.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Melba Priscila

texts.es:
MELBA tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene una hija, vive con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Pechiche Reciunto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantòn Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrìcolas, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MELBA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder sembrar.
Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas.

El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas, enfermedades en las siembras y la competencia. El sueño es tener su propio riego para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar
texts.en:
MELBA is 33 years old. She is single and has a daughter. She lives with her daughter in the city of Ventanas, Los Rios province.

The is a member of the ANCHOVETA communal bank. It is located in the Pechiche parish,  Anchoveta precinct, belonging to the Pueblo Viejo canton. People there work in farming and ranching. 

MELBA is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs to plant. She does her buying and selling in Ventanas.

Challenges she faces are pests and diseases in the crops, as well as competition. Her dream is to have her own irrigation for the crops. In her free time, she likes to play.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Madiina

texts.en: Madiina is a 42-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a secretary for twenty years and runs a stationary shop to get additional income. She hopes to complete her education yet school fees is a challenge. Madiina is requesting for a loan to pay school fees for herself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is a thirty eight year old married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is farming alongside running a bar to boost her income. Her vision is to build a permanent house in order to provide a decent home for her children, and to expand her bar business to new areas. Price fluctuation and high cost of rent pose a challenge to her business. Gertrude will use the loan to buy stock like beer, soda and spirits to sell at her bar.

loans.use: to buy stock of beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar en su negocio, ya que vende ropa y asi mismo fabrica cubrecamas y manteles, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar ropa para damas y niñas, tales como: pantalones, faldas, camisas, chores, trajes, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos, las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en: María needs to request a new loan to continue with her business.  She sells clothing and also makes bedspreads and tablecloths, among other items.  This loan will help her to busy women’s and girls' clothing such as:  pants, skirts, shorts, suits, etc. The previous loan helped her increase her inventories and her income.  Her economic conditions have improved and her family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shirts, shorts, suits, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to participate in a local festival and to advertise her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover production costs on her latest film.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben has more than five years of experience in the printing and signage business. As owner of Cesar’s Printing N Signs, located in El Paso, Ruben offers the latest design for printed banners, invitations, custom T-shirt printed logos, business cards, flyers and brochures.

Since he started his business, Ruben has ensured quality remains his first priority. Ruben employs three individuals and plans to hire one additional employee in the near future. 

Ruben turned to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan after hearing about the non-profit microlender through a local marketing campaign. He applied, and after a short period of time, received an approval for a $5,450 loan. Ruben used the Accion loan to continue operations, pay for wages for his employees, and purchase an updated printing machine. “I would have made less profit and would have had to use contractors if I did not receive the Accion loan,” Ruben says.  

Ruben plans to continue gaining business through social media and further developing his website.

loans.use: to continue operations, pay for wages for his employees, and purchase an updated printing machine.

loans.name: Fructuoso

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Fructuoso resembró parte de su finca gracias al crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva. Con estos trabajos dentro de dos años su cosecha aumentará aproximadamente 10 toneladas y para que esto sea posible requiere de un nuevo crédito pues necesita comprar fertilizante orgánico para las nuevas plantas así como realizar labores de limpieza y mantenimiento de su finca. A Fructuoso le pareció muy buena la opción de financiamiento por parte de Kiva ya que el plazo para pagar el crédito fue al final de la cosecha que es cuando los productores tienen más recurso económico.
texts.en: During the previous harvest, Fructuoso replanted part of his farm thanks to the Kiva loan he got.  With this work, in two years his crop yield will increase approximately 10 tons and in order for this to be possible he needs a new loan because he needs to buy organic manure for the new plants as well as to do the weeding and other maintenance chores on his farm.  Fructuoso related that he thought Kiva financing was a very good option because the payment term was at the end of harvest which is when producers have the most economic resources.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to weed his farm.

loans.name: Yesica Yamileth

texts.es:
Yesica es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de un año y medio. Se dedica a oficios domésticos y a vender antojitos todas las tardes; vende papas fritas, pasteles y enchiladas. Negocio que lo realiza des de hace un año y vende un poco todos los días este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de generar ingresos al hogar.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar papas, Queso, Salsas Y una cocina de gas para la elaboración de las papas fritas. Así, estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de tener lo que siempre ha necesitado para el desarrollo de su actividad lo que es su cocina de gas, mejorara su calidad de vida porque ya no estará inhalando el humo de la leña con eso se considera que se puede evitar de cualquier molestia de los bronquios.
Su sueño más grande dice que es, en el futuro con su trabajo que realiza es tener el dinero para  instalar la energía eléctrica que por el momento no la tiene y des pues vendrán otros sueños.
texts.en:
Yesica is 22 and lives with her partner and their 18-month-old daughter. Yesica does housework and sells a variety of foods every afternoon: potato chips, enchiladas, and pastries. Yesica began this business a year ago to earn income for her household expenses and and she sells a little food every day.  

Yesica is applying for a loan from the Fundación Campo [Campo Foundation] to purchase potatoes, cheese, salsas, and a gas stove to prepare potato chips. The purchase of ingredients and a gas stove will give Yesica what she needs to run her business and improve her quality of life. She'll also no longer have to breathe the smoke from firewood and can avoid bronchial irritants. 

Yesica's greatest ambition is that she will one day earn enough from her work to install electricity to her home. Once she's achieved this, she'll move on to other dreams.

loans.use:
para comprar papas, Queso, Salsas Y una cocina de gas para la elaboración de las papas fritas. 
to purchase potatoes, cheese, salsas, and a gas stove to prepare potato chips.

loans.name: Ensa

texts.en: Ensa is 47 years old, married has four children. She is working as a nurse while her husband works as a driver for a private company where he earns a very low salary. They live in the western part of Kosovo. It is very difficult for them to save money because they are raising children. For many years she could not fence her yard because she could not save the money. Now Ensa is requesting a loan to pay for this work. The loan will give her children a better place to play and enclose her property. She is hoping in the future to have a better life, but her goal for now to give her children a good education.  She thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to fence her yard.

loans.name: Ras Al Nabeh Group

texts.en:
Ras Al Nabeh is a group of three Filipino women who work as housekeepers for Lebanese families in order to make a living and send money to their loved ones in their homeland, the Philippines.
They formed a group to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because it is the best way for them to meet their needs.
Velliamor is the featured borrower of Ras Al Nabeh Group. She is a 37-year-old single mother of three children and she is working hard to provide them with the best possible life. Her children are living with her family back in the Philippines so she has to put extra effort into providing them with almost everything they need because she is far away at a time where they need her most.
Velliamor, who is pictured at the left, her applied for a loan to pay her children's school tuition fees.
As for the other group members, Marie Anne is standing in the middle wearing a yellow shirt, and Rea is on the right.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old, married father of one child. He is a Palestinian refugee, who was born in Lebanon.

For 13 years, Ali has been working in furniture-making. Most of his customers are loyal to him and they support him by recommending him to others.

Ali is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to buy a new, updated tailoring machine and a compressor, necessary for improving his business and responding to his customers' needs.

This will be Ali's third cycle to acquire a loan. His previous loans helped him a lot to increase and update his tools, to keep his business up-to-date. He hopes that, in the future, he can have his own working place, instead of having his machine in others' factories, as he is doing today.

loans.use: to buy a new, updated tailoring machine and a compressor.

loans.name: Heri Group

texts.en:
Aziza, who is in her late 20s, is single with two sons who are in school. For one year now, Aziza has been supporting her family with a food business (mamalishe). She is doing fine in her business and with her family as well. She starts working from 6 pm to midnight daily (she runs her business at night) and is able to earn a small profit per month. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy more food items to improve the varieties offered. She dreams one day she will be improve her business by having a permanent location and good working equipment. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "HERI" which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items to improve the varieties offered.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  María del Carmen  de 27  años  de edad es casada,  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 02  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña María del Carmen su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña María del Carmen vende de todo y gracias a su actividad ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora tiene un buen negocio.
Doña María del Carmen está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pan, leche, azúcar, café, frijoles, queso, salsas, pastas, sal, etc. y con el apoyo de este crédito espera poder ampliara mas su pulpería.
Doña María del Carmen su deseo es tener un mercadito donde atienda más clientes y de esa forma tendrá más ganancias y poder así salir adelante con su familia y mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 27, is married living with her husband and two children in her house; she’s been in the grocery business for two years.  María del Carmen’s business is located in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She sells all basic family staples in her store; she’s a hardworking, very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She sells a little bit of everything and thanks to her activity has been able to move her children forward and to have a good business now.

María del Carmen is asking for the loan to buy bread, milk, sugar, coffee, beans, cheese, sauces, pasta, salt, etc.  With this loan’s support she hopes to be able to expand her grocery store more.  Her wish is to have a small market where she can tend to more customers thus earning higher profits to get ahead with her family and to do some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan José  60  años  de edad es casado,  vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 30  años al negocio de venta de verduras.
Don Juan José sus ventas las realiza en los barrios y colonias en San Lorenzo, el tiene vehículo donde transporta el producto, es una persona trabajadora y honesta que ha logrado tener sus cosas trabajando duro y siendo puntual en sus préstamo, es un buen cliente de Prisma
Don Juan José está solicitando el préstamo para compra de papas, pataste, cebollas, chiles verdes, plátanos, tomates, lechuga, repollo, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Don Juan José su sueño es mejor su carro.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Juan José, 60, is married living at home with his wife.  He’s sold fruit and vegetables for the last 30 years.  He makes his sales in neighborhoods and sectors in San Lorenzo.  He has a vehicle he uses to transport his products.  He’s a hardworking, honest person who has acquired what he has through hard work and by being punctual with his loan; he is a good Prisma client.

Juan José is asking for the loan to buy potatoes, chayote, onions, green chilies, bananas, tomatoes, lettuce, cabbage, etc.  With the loan’s support he intends to improve his business and thus his quality of life.  Juan José’s dream is to improve his car.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2013.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias empresarias una de ellas es Vilma mujer de 56 años de edad, casada. Su negocio es la venta de comida desde hace 6 años, vende su comida en su casa. Tiene de ser cliente en la institución  6 años y el crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de gallinas, arroz por quintal, plátanos, carne de res, carne de cerdo, platano maduro,aceite,etc. Silvia mujer de 24 años, su negocio es venta de tortilla, Isamar mujer de 19  años de edad su negocio es la elaboración y venta de sartenes.
texts.en: This group consists of three enterprising women.  One of them is Vilma who is 56-years-old and married.  Her business for the last 6 years has been selling food at home.  She’s been a client of the institution for six years and she’s requesting the loan to buy chickens, rice by the quintal, bananas, beef, pork, plantain, oil, etc.  Silvia, 24, sells tortillas and Isamar, 19, makes and sells pans.

loans.use: to buy food-making ingredients.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El señor Cristobal está unido de hecho, tiene 47 años de edad, de escolaridad 6to. grado  primaria, tiene 7 hijos y de ellos 5 estan estudiando, se dedica a cultivar la tierra sembrando café, inició este negocio comprando unas plantitas y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para abonar sus cosechas de café, espera en el futuro contar con más terreno para poder cultivar más café y vender por mayor. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican la siembra de maíz y café.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is in common law relationship.  He’s 47-years-old and completed sixth grade in primary school.  He has 7 children five of which are studying.  He works the land growing coffee.  He started the business with the purchase of a few little plants and to date has ten years’ experience.

He organized a group to request a loan that he’ll use to buy fertilizer to nourish his coffee crop.  He hopes in future to own more land to grow more coffee to sell at wholesale.  The other group members work growing corn and coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mery Janeth

texts.es:
MERY tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Pechiche Reciunto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantòn Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrìcolas, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MERY se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la agricultura.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas. El desafío a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima.
El sueño es tener un regadío propio para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Mery, 41, is single and has a son she lives with in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Pechinche Parish, Anchoveta Recinto, belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; they work in agriculture.  It belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton and they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Mery works in agriculture growing corn and rice.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer and manure.  With the loan’s help she’ll be able to buy what she needs for agriculture.  Her purchases and sales take place in Ventanas and the challenges she faces are competition and bad weather.  Her dream is to have her own irrigation system for her crops.  She likes spending her free time with her son.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Felix Octavio

texts.es:
Félix,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para incrementar la mercadería y sus inventarios; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar artículos de primera necesidad tales como: azúcar, sal, frijol, arroz, aceite, jabón, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que las condiciones económicas han mejorado, por lo que incrementaron sus ventas y aperturo una nueva tienda en el mismo municipio.
texts.en:
Félix needs to obtain a new loan because he needs more working capital to increase his merchandise and inventory. This loan will help him to buy essential things like sugar, salt, beans, rice, oil, soap, and other things.

The effect of his previous loan was positive since economic conditions have improved, therefore he increased his sales and opened a new store in the same municipality.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, rice, oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Leonel Alonso

texts.es: Don Leonel es originario de León.  Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y bicicletas. Su anterior crédito lo utilizo para comprar accesorios de motos y bicicletas lo cual le ayudo mucho, ya que pudo comprar productos para su negocio. Solicita este nuevo crédito, para comprar rines, llantas, neumáticos, rayos, aceites, espejos entre otros. Al adquirir el préstamo seguirá trabajando para   aumentar sus ventas y lograr mantener sus clientes activos. Su plan futuro es comprar un local para su negocio, ya que donde comercializa sus productos alquila, su meta próxima es cancelar el préstamo para  mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en: Leonel is from León.  He works selling spare parts for motorcycles and bicycles.  He used his previous loan to buy motorcycle and bicycle accessories; it was a great help because he was able to buy products for his business.  He’s asking for this new loan to buy rims, tires, inner tubes, spokes, oil and mirrors, among others.  By getting this loan he’ll be able to continue working to increase sales and retain his active customers.  His future plan is to buy a locale for his business because he rents the place he’s using now.  His next goal is to repay the loan to keep his business stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and supplies.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 46 años de edad, es originaria de león, está casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Ella es comerciante, su crédito  anterior lo utilizo para comprar cosméticos, lo cual le fue muy bien, ya que obtuvo demanda en sus productos. Hoy está solicitando este crédito para comprar 2 vitrinas y cosméticos. Su meta futura es tener su propia tienda de cosméticos y con el tiempo mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en: María, 46, is from León.  She’s married and has three children in her care.  She’s a merchant.  She used her previous loan to buy cosmetics and she did very well because she had demand for her products.  Today, she’s requesting this loan to buy two display cases and cosmetics.  His future goal is to have her own cosmetics store and in time to improve her home’s infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy two display cases and cosmetics.

loans.name: Andres Eduardo

texts.es:
ANDRES tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

ANDRES se dedica la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos orgánicos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es sembrar más hectáreas de maíz y un riego propio de riego.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el boli.
texts.en:
Andres is 20 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives with his mother in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. He is a member of the Ventanilla Bendición de Dios, which is located in the Rancho Grande precinct in the Puerto Pechiche parish. This group works in agriculture and livestock.

Andres grows rice and corn. He requests this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and organic manure. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the necessary items for his crops. He makes his purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to plant more hectares of rice and have his own irrigation system. The challenges that he faces include pests and competition. In his free time, he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and organic manure.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
ANASTACIO tiene 69 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la compañera en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Anastacio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura las compras las realizará en ventanas. El sueño es tener un rigo propio. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pescar por las tardes.
texts.en:
Anastacio is 69 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and does not have children. He lives with his partner in the Ventana canton, which is the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the VRC Anchoveta, which is located in the Anchoveta precinct of the Puerto Pechiche parish. This group works in agriculture.

Anastacio works in agriculture, growing corn, soy, and rice. He requests this loan to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the necessary items for agriculture. He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to have his own irrigation system. In his free time, he likes to go fishing in the afternoons.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 42-year-old married mother of one child who is attending a private school for a brighter educational future. 

Fatima has been working in tailoring and sewing traditional Abaya (cloak, which is a loose over-garment, it is like a dress, worn by almost all of the women living in Lebanese villages, it keeps them comfortable during warm weather) for twelve years. She designs the Abaya with special beads and textile colors to meet customers’ needs and opinions; this long term experience provided her with customers support, recommendation and loyalty. 

Fatima is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, to buy the fabrics, beads and accessories she needs to develop and expand her business.
Her customers have various views and she has to fit everyone’s needs, which is her main obstacle, she is working hard to achieve.

Fatima is working hard so as to open an updated factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy the fabrics, beads and accessories she needs to develop and expand her business.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 32-year-old married Palestinian Refugee. He has lived in a Palestinian Camp since he was born in Lebanon, and so he has limited options for which field he can work in. 

Wissam is a hard worker, he has been working in the construction domain since 2007, and he has two employees to help him reply to the increasing needs of his customers. What’s good in Wissam’s business is that he is capable of taking projects outside the camp he is living in, which is all because of the trust he gained from his customers who recommended him to others immediately. His good reputation is his weapon against competitors, and he is taking a maximum advantage of this. 

Today he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his wood capital to cover more requested projects. He hopes to keep on expanding his business to cover wider projects in the future and open a construction company that will require more employees and cover all aspects of the construction business.

loans.use: to increase his wood capital to cover more requested projects.

loans.name: Fatehi

texts.en:
Fatehi is a 43-year-old married father of four children, three of them are under eighteen years old; one of them is enrolled in a private school, the other is in a public school. The third child has started working to help his family make a living, because just like almost all the Palestinian refugees living and working in the Palestinian Camps, they have limited access to different working domains.

Fatehi works in the construction field, specialized in laying tiles for twenty years. He is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car that will facilitate his work, as it will allow him to cover wider regions and projects in far-away villages, transporting his toolkit easily from one place to another.

He hopes to keep on replying to customers’ needs, and pleasing them so he can expand his work with the trust and support of his customers.

loans.use: to buy a car that will facilitate his work.

loans.name: Norona Group

texts.fr:
Norona est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits, condiments et des articles divers. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Massan qui est la seule assise à côté   de ses condiments  à vendre.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments de toutes sortes : oignon, sel de cuisine, cube Maggi, aubergines, choux et de la poudre de gombo. Elle se procure de ses articles  au grand marché. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Norona comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 81 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Massan  compte réaliser  90 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Norona is a group of women from the Koulikoro district, in the city of Koutiala, who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other family members. On average, they are 37 years old and have four children. 

They sell miscellaneous merchandise such as clothing, condiments and other items. 

They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to expand their activities. This is their 7th group loan cycle. 

Massan is seen in the photo sitting by her stock of condiments for sale. She plans to use her loan to buy various types of condiments including onions, cooking salt, Maggi bouillon cubes, eggplants, cabbage, and okra powder. She buys her merchandise at the Grand market and sells at retail to a diverse customer base, from her home and at the market, for cash and on credit.

The other group members expect to earn an average profit of 81,000CFA each for this cycle, whereas Massan expects her own profit to reach 90,000FCFA. In addition to loan repayment, the group members will use part of their revenue to cover personal expenses and to bolster their working capital.

loans.use: to buy condiments for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicine to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 30 year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal ,Uganda. His main business is buying and selling goats, alongside passenger transportation in order to boost his income.He faces challenges of business seasonality. He has a vision of buying land to construct a better house and own at least two cars for his transport business. Patrick has applied for a loan to buy a new vehicle to expand his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new vehicle to expand his transport business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and also rent.

She has a business of selling soft drinks and snacks. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. 

Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, Irish potatoes, cooking oil and sausages.

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, potatoes, cooking oil and sausages.

loans.name: Twanzane Traders Group

texts.en: Amis is a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 20 years he has been selling crude salt that is fresh from the lake. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university and set up sustainable income-generating activities for them. Prolonged rains and inadequate capital limit his business growth while his desire is to start processing salt and add value to it so as to sell at a higher price. Amis intends to use his portion of the loan to buy salt to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 27-year-old, married man with one child. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is involved in the transport sector but also practices farming to supplement on his income. High fuel prices and poor road networks affect his business. However, his dream is to diversify business and venture into general sanitation maintenance services as a side income business as well as own a good house. Martin is requesting a loan to buy a grass cutting machine for business purposes.

loans.use: to buy a grass cutting machine for business purposes.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is a 40-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest is 21 while the youngest is nine. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various items like sugar, soap, cooking oil, canned goods and noodles. Her husband earns a livelihood with a fishing activity. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more goods to sell like beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and also to pay school fees. In the future, Cecil would like to support her family as well as  sending all her children to get a college education.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell like beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban operates a spare parts business selling at the market where passersby and fellow villagers are his customers.  He is a very hardworking person  who does everything in order to improve his financial situation and give his family what they need. 

Shaban is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy supplies for his spare parts business in order to continue providing his customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his spare parts business

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has operated a clothes-selling business, where he sells at the market to town-dwellers and his neighbors. He cites his major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan he is requesting, Anthony wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business. He appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 53 years old. She lives in the small village of Dusheti district with her 17-year-old daughter, who goes to school. Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nana works as tailor. She gets orders and sews bed-clothing from home. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

Nana requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Nana will purchase a stock of patterns. After the stock is purchased, she will be able to offer her clients wide assortments of bed-clothing, which will increase her sales and thus the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of patterns and sew a wide assortments of bed-clothing.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man who has been selling water since 2005. He is a Palestinian refugee who puts forth much effort to improve his living standard. Ahmad used to sell vegetables but he found out that most of his villagers need clean water to drink. So, he turned to selling water because it is a daily necessity.
Ahmad is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase the number of water bottles available before the Holy Ramadan month where people consume water more than normally.
This would be his second loan as an Al Majmoua borrower. Through his previous loan, he was capable of buying a living room for his parents to keep them living in a healthy space.
He hopes to open a shop and distribute water to nearby villages.

loans.use: To increase the number of water bottles available before the Holy Ramadan month where people consume more water

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 38-year-old, married father of four children. For 17 years, he has been selling birds.    

Husein is a hard worker. To cover his family’s needs, he also has an additional income business. He has a convenience store that covers part of his family’s needs, since it depends on daily income business. Husein’s favorite business is dealing with birds because it is his best hobby and he finds himself among his beloved birds.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase the diversity of the birds he is selling, to attract new customers and draw attention. 

One of the major problems he is facing is the lack of cash to buy the requested materials, at the exact, requested time. Husein hopes to reach a level that he can develop his business anytime he finds this need.

loans.use: to increase the diversity of the birds he is selling, to attract new customers.

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru: Абдувахобу 19 лет. Он успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Технический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он поступил в факультет Строительство и связь по специальности Энергоснабжения. Он говорит, что его мечта сбилась: Он студент! Абдувахоб имеет большие планы и надежды. Он прекрасный человек. Абдувахоб должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abduvahob is 19 years old.  He successfully completed a secondary school and got accepted to the Technical Institute of the Tajikistan Technological University.  He got accepted to the Construction and Communication department with an Energy-Supply major.  He says that his dream came true - he is a student!  Abduvahob has big plans and hopes.  He is a beautiful person.  Abduvahob has to pay for his tuition, but does not have money.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru: Нозимджону 18 лет. Он умный и трудолюбивый человек. Нозимджон не женат и живет с родителями. Он в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил на первый курс Технического Института Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он поступил по специальности Экономист - программист. Нозимджон целенаправлен на то, чтобы успешно учится в университете и будущем стал хорошим специалистом. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но его родители не в состоянии поддержать его. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nozimjon is 18 years old.  He is a smart and hardworking person.  Nozimjon is not married and lives with his parents.  He successfully completed a secondary school this year and got accepted to the first year of the Technical Institute of the Tajikistan Technological University.  He got accepted with the Economist-Programmer major.  Nozimjon is motivated to successfully study at the university and to become a good specialist in the future.  He has to pay for his tuition, but his parents cannot support him.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: El Buen Amigo Group

texts.es: Este grupo está conformado por tres socias una de ellas es Nohemi mujer de 62 años de edad, acompañada, tiene a cargo a su hermana enferma. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y comida desde hace 3 años. Este crédito lo invertirá para comprar blusas, ropa interior, ropa de niño, zapatos, pantalones, uniformes. María mujer de 27 años su negocio es la venta de comida y María Dolores tiene 64 años de edad y su negocio es compra y venta de leña.
texts.en: This group is made up of 3 associates. One of them is Nohemi, 62, who has a partner and takes care of her sick sister. For 3 years, she has run her clothing and food sales business. This loan is to invest in blouses, underwear, children's clothing, shoes, pants and uniforms. The other associates and their businesses are Maria, 27, who sells food and María Dolores, 64, who buys and sells firewood.

loans.use: invest in blouses, underwear, children's clothing, shoes, pants and uniforms.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana nació en la ciudad de Puno pero ahora vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo, a la venta productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar y fideos y tambien a la venta de verduras, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y esta implementada con la necesidades básicas, ella a tiende a sus vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y abarrotes para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Juana  was born in the city of Puno, but she now lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, she is 40 years old, married and has four children that she gets ahead, she works selling chicken meat and first necessity products such as rice, sugar, pasta, as well as vegetables, she has a sale stand in one of the markets of the city of Paucartambo where she offers her products, the sales stand is set up with basic services, she sells to her neighbors and friends with kindness and politeness, reason why they always come back to buy.  It has been several years that she works in this business  and she does well thanks to the effort she puts in her work.  She belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Carmen" and at this time she needs the loan to buy vegetables and groceries to increase capital in the business.  She is thankful and values the loan and commits to meet the monthly payments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groceries

loans.name: Oliener Eduardo

texts.es: Oliener, es un joven soltero de 24 años de edad, no tiene hijos, trabajador, actualmente habita en casa de su abuelita a quien le ayuda económicamente. El trabaja como promotor de crédito en una empresa privada. Actualmente estudia la carrera de Técnico en Administración de Empresas, requiere comprar una computadora para realizar sus investigaciones y no andar prestando dicho equipo, por lo antes expuesto solicita apoyo de crédito para así logar comprar esta herramienta tan importante para su desarrollo profesional y lograr su meta, culminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Oliener is a 24-year-old single man; he has no children.  He’s hardworking and currently lives in his grandmother’s house and helps her out economically.  He works as a credit agent for a private firm and at the same time is studying the technical career of Business Administration Technician.  He needs to buy a computer to do his research and not having to borrow said equipment.  Because of this, he’s asking for a loan to buy this very important tool for his professional development and to reach his goal which is to complete his studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: De Lo Alto Viene Lo Bueno Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios exitosos una de ellas es  Isadora mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos  de Avon y zafiro desde hace 4 años. Sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad. El crédito lo solicita para comprar  cosméticos como perfume de varón, perfume de mujer, delineadores, pinturas de uñas, labial, mascara, crema facial y crema de cuerpos. Olendya tiene 23 años de edad y su negocio es comerciante de condimentos. Y Carlos hombre de 41 años su negocio es cafetín.
texts.en: This group consists of three successful members.  One of them is Isadora, 36, who is married with three children.  Her business for the last four years has been selling Avon and Zafiro cosmetics in her community.   She’s requesting the loan to buy cosmetics like men’s perfume, women’s perfume, eyeliner, nail polish, lipstick, mascara, face cream and body cream.  Olendya, 23, sells condiments and Carlos, 41, has a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Gracias al crédito obtenido por kiva la cosecha pasada Eusebio pudo comprar fertilizantes para lograr aumentar su producción, para esta nueva etapa Eusebio necesita un nuevo crédito para el pago de jornaleros que son los que le ayudaran en la limpieza de su finca para que este en optimas condiciones en el momento que llegue la cosecha.
texts.en: Thanks to the Kiva loan he got for his previous harvest, Eusebio was able to buy fertilizer to increase production.  For this new stage, Eusebio needs a new loan to pay for day laborers to help him weed the farm so that it will be in optimum conditions when harvest time comes.

loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 39-year-old, married father of two children. To make his living, he works in vehicle repairs, specializing in body work. His wife doesn’t work and his children are enrolled in a private school, which forces him to put so much effort to develop his business, to make sure that it will develop to cover his family’s increasing requirements.

Nahed is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to perform necessary maintenance on his house. He can’t afford to pay for this external need from his business since his income barely covers his family’s required needs, and not more. He has to fix the ceiling from the winter’s leakage, to keep his house a healthy living environment for his beloved family.

This is Nahed's fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development borrower. He has a good-standing history of paying back his loans. His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his business and in covering his family’s needs. They made a positive push forward, according to his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Kankélé Group

texts.fr:
Kankélé est un regroupement de femmes de Darsalam I de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habits, de condiments, de la restauration,  des articles  divers,  etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe. 
Fanta  est un membre du groupe Kankélé arrêté en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des colis d’habits. Elle se procure de ses habits  au grand marché. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kankélé comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 175 500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fanta compte réaliser  195.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kankélé is a group of women from Darsalam I, in Koutiala, who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other family members. On average, they are 41 years old and have five children. 

They conduct various activities such as the sale clothing, condiments, other items, and also restaurant services. 

They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to expand their activities. This is their 10th group loan cycle. 

Fanta is seen in the photo standing first from the right. She plans to use her loan to buy clothing. She buys her merchandise at the Grand market and sells at retail for cash to a diverse customer base, from her home and at the market.

The other group members expect to earn an average profit of 175,500CFA each for this cycle, whereas Fanta expects her own profit to reach 195,000FCFA. In addition to loan repayment, the group members will use part of their revenue to cover personal expenses and to bolster their working capital.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Mario de 42 años de edad, casado, con cuatro hijos a su cargo de 22, 19, 15, y 12 años. Su negocio es comprador y vendedor de granos básicos. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en compra por quintal de frijoles, maíz, trigo. Alexander tiene 26 años de edad su negocio es venta de granos básicos, María tiene 42 años de edad y su negocio es venta de frutas y Lesbia mujer de 42 años de edad y su negocio es venta de frutas y comida
texts.en: This group is made up of 3 entrepreneurial associates. One of the members is Mario, 42, who is married and has 4 children under his care, ages 22, 19, 15 and 12. His business is buying and selling basic grains. He's been with the institution for 4 years. He'll invest the loan in buying 100 kg of beans, corn and wheat. Other members are Alexander, 26, whose business is selling basic grains; Maria, 42, whose business is selling fruit; and Lesbia, 42, whose business is selling fruit and food.

loans.use: invest in buying 100 kg of beans, corn and wheat.

loans.name: El Faisán Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Lourde de 37 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Su negocio es la venta de perecederos desde hace 20 años. Sus productos los comercializa en el mercado. Tiene 8 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en sacos de cebolla, papa, zanahoria, chiltoma, tomate, etc. Rosa tiene 38 años de edad y su negocio es venta de perecederos y Jessi tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es venta de perecederos.
texts.en: This group consists of three members.  One of them is Lourdes, 37.  She’s single and has a minor son.  Her business for the last 20 years has been selling perishables in the market.  She’s been a client of the institution for 8 years.  She requests the loan to buy sacks of onions, potatoes, carrots, peppers, tomatoes, etc.  Rosa, 38, sells perishables and Jessi, 31, sells perishables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mayling Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxitos uno de  ellos es Juana de 45 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años ambulantes en las calles de Masaya, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 4 años consecutivos y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como chayotes, pipián, papaya, melón, piña, naranjas etc. Luis hombre de 55 años de edad su negocio es la venta de verduras y Carlos tiene 22 años y su negocio es la venta de perecederos
texts.en: This group consists of three successful entrepreneurs.  One of them is Juana, 45.  She’s married and her business for the last 15 years has been selling fruit and vegetables from place to place along Masaya’s streets.  She’s been a client of the institution for 4 years and will use the loan to buy vegetables like chayote, pumpkin, melon, pineapple, oranges, etc.  Luis, 55, sells vegetables and Carlos, 22, sells perishables.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Camino Del Desierto Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Ligia mujer de 34 años, soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon y un cafetín en su domicilio desde hace 10 años. Tiene de ser clientes con la institución 4 años lo que refleja que es una buena cliente responsables en sus pagos, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como  perfumen de varón, perfumen de dama, loción de varón, cremas faciales, cremas para manos, cremas para cuerpos, cremas para pies, champo, delineadores, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, etc. Brenda mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos y Verónica tiene 29 años y su negocio es la venta y compra de zapatos también.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members.  One of them is Ligia, 34.   She’s single with a minor son.  Her business for the last 10 years has been selling Avon products and also has a snack bar at home.  

She’s been a client of the institution for 4 years which shows that she’s a good client who is responsible with her payments.  She will use this loan to buy cosmetics like men’s perfume, women’s perfume, men’s lotion, face cream, hand cream, body cream, foot cream, shampoo, eyeliner, nail polish, lipstick, etc.  Brenda, 29, sells shoes and Verónica, 29, buys and sells shoes too.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata  est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de  2 enfants. Elle vit avec ses deux enfants dans une famille nucléaire à ATTbougou, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Aminata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente d’habillements et bijoux : des pagnes wax des Tissus brodés, des bazins riches, des colliers en chaines et des boucles d’oreilles.) depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre de façon ambulantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année. Elle est à son troisième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement rembourser.
Ce troisième prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter 15 pièces de pagne wax,  20 paquets de colliers en chaine, 10 paquets de boucle d’oreilles et 10 complets de bazins riches .
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Madame Aminata  is 42, married and the mother of two children. She lives with her two children in a nuclear family at Attbougou, one of the populous neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republique of Mali. 

Madame Aminata tried a lot of activities without success, then began this income-generating activity, selling clothing and jewelry ("wax" African print cloth, embroidered cloth, "rich" damask, necklaces and earrings) more than five years ago. 

She buys her merchandise in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso) before hawking it on foot to a clientele composed essentially of women. She is much in demand among her customers because of the good quality of her products. In order to satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than a year ago.

She is on her third individual loan, with all her preceding loans appropriately reimbursed. This third individual loan will allow her to buy 15 lengths of African print cloth, 20 packets of necklaces (chains) 10 packets of earrings, and 10 outfits of "rich" damask. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be utilized to grow her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy various articles

loans.name: Octavio Eduardo

texts.es: Octavio tiene treinta (30) años de edad, vive en la hermosa ciudad de Barranquilla, apodada “Curramba la Bella”, con su conyugue y tres (3) hijos, asi, un niño de un (1) año, y dos (2) hijas de cinco (5) y siete (7) años respectivamente.
