She will use the 1,500 new soles to buy a variety of food items seeking the lowest prices to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chamilonge est leader du groupe d’affaire « Ishara», femme entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un vendeur d’objets divers (chainette, bijoux, bagues, etc.) La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses produits au long de la rue et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 2 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 paniers de fruits (avocats), 1 sac haricots, les bananes plantains, les oronges, les courges, etc. La pourriture, détérioration sont des défis pour le développement de son activité.  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Chamilonge is the representative of the "Ishara" business group. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 48 years old, married and the mother of 7 children who are all in education. Her husband is a seller of various items (chains, jewelry, rings etc), and she is a food seller. She displays her products along the roadside and sometimes also at her home. She started her business with her own capital received from her husband, about two years ago. She will use this new loan to buy two baskets of fruit (avocados), 1 bag of beans, some plantains, oranges, squash, etc. Rotting and deterioration of the fruit are challenges in the development of her business. Still, she wants to grow her business, educate and feed her children.
Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support for small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase avocados, beans, plantains, oranges, and squash for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aissata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe existe depuis avril 2010. Il est composé de femmes issues du même quartier commerçantes et unies par de bonnes relations sociales.

Madame Aissata, levant la main, est la représentante dudit groupe, elle âgée de 53 ans mariée et mère  d'un garçon de 28 ans. Elle s'active dans le commerce de légumes et d poissons frais.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 400000 francs CFA elle va se payer des paniers de légumes d'une valeur de 75000 francs par semaine et et des panier de poissons d'une valeur de 25000 francs cfa par semaine.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge certaines dépenses quotidiennes de sa 

familles.
texts.en:
This group has been in existence since April 2010 and comprises women who come from the same neighborhood.  The members of the group work in retail and are united by good social relationships.

Aissata (raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative.  She is 53 years old, married, and has a 28-year-old son.  She is actively involved in selling vegetables and fresh fish.

With her new loan of 400,000 CFA francs, she will spend 75,000 per week to buy some baskets of vegetables and 25,000 CFA francs per week to buy baskets of fresh fish.

The profits from her activity allow her to take care of some of her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables for retail sale.

loans.name: Akouwavi

texts.fr: Akouwavi vit avec son conjoint et leurs enfants de 02 enfants scolarisés à LOME. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises.  Elle espère à l’avenir élargir son activité et assurer aux mieux au besoin de la famille.
texts.en: Akouwavi lives with her spouse and their two children, both enrolled in school, in Lome. She sells cosmetics and is asking for a first loan to buy merchandise. She hopes in future to expand her business and take care of all the family needs as well as possible.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Tugumane Group

texts.fr:
Jérôme fait partie du groupe  Tugumane  et habite à Muramvya . Il  a 42 ans et est marié à  Jeanine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.
  
Il fait le commerce de  boutique(riz, haricot, savon, …) depuis 2  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot, et de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter des lopins de terre pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jérôme is a member of the Tugumane group and he lives in Muramvya.  He is 42 years old and married to Jeanine, a farmer.  They have three children together.

Jérôme has been selling grocery products for two years (rice, beans, soap..)

This is his second loan with Turame.  With the loan that he is receiving from Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of beans and rice for resale, in order to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, he would like to buy some plots of land for his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Enyonam Kpeme Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENYONAM KPEME est un ensemble de personnes travaillant dans des domaines très diversifiés. Du maraîchage à la vente d’ordinateurs en passant par des forgeron et ferrailleur, ce groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès  de WAGES. Monsieur Assion est le responsable du groupe cité. Ce revendeur exerce dans la restauration et plus particulièrement dans la viande de porc depuis 2000. Marié et à charge de 7 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés, il espère que le crédit sollicité lui permettra de remplir ses objectifs principaux, c'est-à-dire, fidéliser ses clients et élargir sa clientèle, réinvestir dans l’activité. Mais surtout améliorer la vie quotidienne de sa conjointe et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group called ENYONAM KPEME is composed of people working in various fields. From market gardening to selling computers, blacksmiths to scrap metal dealers, the members of this group are requesting their first loan from WAGES. 

Mr. Assion is the leader of this group. This retailer has been working in food preparation and particularly in pork since 2000. Married and responsible for seven children, of whom three are enrolled in school, he hopes that the requested loan will allow him to meet his principal goals, which are to make his customers want to come back to buy from him and to expand his clientele, reinvesting in his business. But especially to improve the daily life of his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy pork and retail goods.

loans.name: Tiessiri  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIESSIRI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Diediela, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et mil avec   KOROTOUMOU ,  2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1,25  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sido,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 120.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the TIESSIRI 4 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Diediela, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Korotoumou, a member of the group, grows groundnuts and millet. In the photo, she is second from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.25 hectare (3 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village and in Sido.

She is expecting to make a profit of 120,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and to cover the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 1  sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43  ans, 7 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs  avec Yacouba 1er debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Garalo  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  150.000  FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married men who are, on average, 43 years old with seven children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their second loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loan.

Yacouba, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, he is standing first from the right.

Yacouba plans to use his loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate two hectares (4.97 acres) of land.

After the harvest, he sells his production to both men and women, in his village and in Garalo.

He is expecting to make a profit of 150,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow him to repay his loan and to take care of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2  sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37  ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs  avec Bakary 1er debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Garalo  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  155.000  FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et s'occuper des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married men who average 37 years of age and four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village of Bougouni, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 2nd loan cycle with the MFI, and the first loan was correctly repaid. 

Bakary, standing first from the right, sells maize. He plans to use his loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing of 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the crop is sold in the village and in Garalo to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Bakary expects to earn a profit of 155,000 FCFA by season end, which he will use to repay his loan and take care of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing of his farmland.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bulambo est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Ushindi», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers usagers. Elle installe ses articles au marché. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 ballons de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The borrower, Bulambo, is the leader of the business group "Ushindi". She is 36 years old and a young, although experienced, entrepreneur. She is also married and the mother of six children who all attend school. Her husband works as a teacher in a public school.  

Bulambo sells used shoes, displaying her goods at the market. She started in this business using her own funds, received from her husband. 

She will use this new loan to buy three bales of used shoes. She hopes to be able to expand her activity, feed and educate her children, and build a nice house.

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for providing support to small-scale entrepreneurs, through micro-credit.

loans.use: to buy three bales of used shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Icela Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores  uno de ellos es Margarita mujer de 46 años de edad, acompañada. Su negocio es la venta de verduras desde hace 15 años, vende sus productos en el mercado. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en más inventario como son chiltoma, tomate, cebolla, pipián, zanahoria, papas, chayote, ayote, quequisque, etc. Marta tiene 40 años de edad y su negocio es comerciante de frijoles, ajo, guayaba y Frander tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es venta de frutas
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members.  One of them is Margarita, who is 46 years old and has a partner.  For 15 years, her business has been selling vegetables.  She sells her products in the market.  She requests this loan to invest in more inventory like peppers, tomatoes, onions, squash, carrots, potatoes, pear squash, taro root, etc. 

Marta is 40 years old and her business is selling beans, garlic, and guava.  Frander is 20 years old and his business is selling fruits.

loans.use: to invest in more inventory like peppers, tomatoes, onions, squash, carrots, potatoes, pear squash, taro root, etc.

loans.name: Kary

texts.es: Kary tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y vive en una casa alquilada junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Kary se dedica a  la venta de comestibles variados para eso cuenta con un espacio en su casa donde almacena su mercadería. Iniciándose hace más de 03 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, logrando hacerlo gracias a la buena acogida que tiene. Y hasta el momento le apoya su esposo en la compra de la mercadería, y en la venta sus familiares residentes en los caseríos que visita. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite  contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto, y viendo los buenos resultados  tiene planes de ampliar con la venta de ropas. Esto será el cuarto préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Con el monto de 1800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de mercadería variada como comestibles para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kary, 47, is married living in a rented house with her husband and two children.  Kary works selling varied food items; she has space at home where she stores the goods.  

She started out more than three years ago because she needed to have income and she managed to do so thanks to the good welcome she’s had.  To date, she gets support from her husband who helps her buy the merchandise and from her family members who live in the settlements she visits.  

She likes her business because it gives her the peace of mind having a source of income to help her spouse with household expenses provides.  Seeing the good results she’s having she plans to expand by going into clothes sales.   

This will be her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to make her plans reality.  She will use the 1,800 new soles to buy varied food items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy food items like rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris tiene 43 años,  está casada y vive en su casa propia que construyo junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Damaris se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces variadas, las cuales prepara en casa, para luego llevarlos a vender pedidos a las  tiendas. Realiza ésta actividad desde hace más de 03 años, contando con el apoyo de sus hijos en la elaboración y reparto de los dulces. Le gusta su actividad ya que lo mantiene ocupada, y porque puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, además de poder manejar su propio horario de trabajo. Tiene planes de seguir ampliando su negocio. Esto será el sexto préstamo con Kiva, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Además, se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá  en la compra de una amasadora de harina para la elaboración de los dulces. Además de insumos necesarios para la elaboración los dulces como harinas, mantequillas, mantecas y otros.
texts.en:
Damaris, 43, is married living in her the house she built with her husband and three children.  Damaris works making and selling various home-made sweets that she sells to order in stores.  

She’s been in this line of work for more than three years and she gets help from her children making and delivering the sweets.  She likes her activity because it keeps her busy and because she’s able to help her spouse with household expenses and with her children’s education as well as being able to set her own work schedule.  She plans to continue expanding the business.  

This will be her 6th Kiva loan so she’s counting on your collaboration to continue towards her objectives.  Also, she commits to be punctual with her installment payments like she’s been in previous loans.  

She will use the 2,000 new soles to buy a dough kneader to make the sweets as well as necessary ingredients to make the sweets like flour, butter, shortening and others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and butter.

loans.name: Menuna

texts.en:
31-year-old Menuna lives in the West Point area which has the biggest market in Montserrado County. She is unmarried and has seven children living at home aged one month to sixteen years. Six are in school. Unfortunately, she did not attend school herself. She describes herself as an honest woman.

For the past four years Menuna has sold fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancé. Most of the time she uses a share-taxi to get her goods to her table in the market. She works nine hours a day and enjoys her work because she has lots of customers and makes a good profit.

Menuna is applying for a 25,000 LRD loan to buy additional fish to sell. She plans to build a house and educate her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is 20 years old and a single man living with his uncle and brother in the village of Orbeli. He installs satellite television dishes in his district. He gets a small monthly salary and is the only one earning money in his household.

Mirian would like to work as a driver for the company as well. There is a vacancy for drivers, but owning a car is a necessary condition for this position.

Mirian applied for a 2300 USD loan through Credo. His loan request was approved within the framework of the Start-Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva that permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

This loan will help Mirian buy a secondhand car and enable him to fill the driver opening. This means he will have an additional position in the company and double the salary. It is obvious that this will be hard for Mirian, but he is ready to deal with the difficulties as he’s a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to get ahead.

This loan will be a great help for the family. Mirian is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to make more money.

loans.use: to get a second job as a driver

loans.name: La Patience Goumoukope Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PATIENCE GOUMOUKOPE KPOCA ANEHO est spécialisé dans le maraîchage. La totalité de ses membres, c'est-à-dire 10 personnes, travaille dans ce domaine. Ce groupe est représenté par Monsieur  Mawuko. Cet homme de 35 ans est marié et a deux enfants, tous deux scolarisés. Il exerce dans la profession depuis 2008. Et ce en parallèle avec son métier de taxi-moto. Monsieur Mawuko a le même objectif que tous les membres du groupe. C'est-à-dire garder toute sa clientèle et même l’élargir par exemple en agrandissant son champ d’activité. Si ces objectifs sont remplis, lui et tout son groupe pourront considérablement améliorer le mode de vie des familles et leur bien être au quotidien.
texts.en:
The group called LA PATIENCE GOUMOUKOPE KPOCA ANEHO is specialized in market gardening. All ten of its members work in this business. This group is represented by Monsieur Mawuko. This 35-year-old man is married and has two children, both in school. He has been working at this business since 2008, doing it alongside his main job as a motorcycle taxi driver.  

Monsieur Mawuko has the same goal as all the members of the group, that is, he wants to keep all his customers and even expand his clientele, for example by expanding his field of endeavor. If his goals are met, he and all his group will be able to improve living conditions and the daily welfare of their families considerably.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hely

texts.es: Hely, de 26 años es una joven madre. Vive en compañía de su hija y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Hely se dedica a la agricultura, por está razón heredo  algunas extensiones de terreno de sus padres en donde se cultiva; papa, maíz, habas entre otros productos más, sus cosechas los vende al por mayor en el mercado de la ciudad pero mientras espera su cosecha  trabaja como educadora de personas adultas enseñándoles a leer y escribir, además de poseer 6 ovejas pequeñas, las que lleva a comer en las praderas de su ciudad.Disfruta de cada trabajo que realiza porque le agrada y tiene conocimientos que le permiten desempeñarse de manera óptima, ve el futuro con gran entusiasmo y desea tener mayores ingresos para el futuro de su hija. Este es su tercer crédito con kiva y se agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Hely, invertirá S/. 1200 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: 26 year old Hely is a young mother. she lives with her daughter and siblings in her parent's home. Hely farms on some lands she inherited from her parents where she grows potatoes, corn, beans and other products. She sells her harvests wholesale in the city market but while she is waiting for her harvest she works as a teacher of adults, teaching them to read and write. In addition she owns 6 small sheep. She takes them to eat in the meadows of her city. she enjoys each job that she does because the work pleases her and she has knowledge that enables her to perform at her best. She looks to the future with great enthusiasm and she wishes to have increased income for her daughter's future. This is her third loan with kiva and she is thankful for the financial support that she receives in order to continue forward. In addition she promises to pay her payments punctually. Hely will invest the S/.1200 soles in buying organic fertilizer for her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es: Kelita tiene 54 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo.  Kelita se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños. Pide los modelos desde el capital, y luego lo vende a sus clientes, que aprecian la calidad de sus productos. Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y tener una ocupación, además de estar en casa y el tiempo libre que lo emplee en el cuidado de sus animales como pollos y patos. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias  que le deja, y por tanto desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías y lograr hacer crecer su negocio. Esto es el 04 préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de un mayor número de zapatos de diversos modelos, para tener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en: Kelita is 54 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband. Kelita sells shoes for women, men and children. She orders the shoes from the capital and then sells them to her customers, who appreciate the quality of her products. She has be in this business for more than 10 years, and up until now has worked alone. She likes her business as it generates a income and provides a job, in addition to being home and in her free time she takes care of animals such as chickens and ducks. She considers her business rather profitable for the earnings it provides, and so she would like to increase her stock of merchandise in order to grow her business. This is her 4th loan with Kiva. She is very content to know that she will have financial support, as in this way she feels assured to grow her business. With the 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying a large number of varied styles of shoes in order to have available stock to sell.

loans.use: to buy different types of shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 25 years old. She is married with one child who goes to school. She sells different items in her shop but she would like to buy potatoes and bananas to sell using the this new loan. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her child.The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and bananas for sale

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 25 years old. She sells water and electricity as an authorized dealer and has set up this new business after leaving shoe sales. She has been in the business for six months. With the loan, she would like to buy more units of both water and electricity for resale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside as more savings.

loans.use: To buy units of water and electricity for sale.

loans.name: Bernabe De Jesus

texts.es:
Bernabé, está acompañado y no tiene hijos, asimismo no posee familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 30 años de edad, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres y lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener seguro el terreno y lo necesario para el cultivo.
Su sueño es construir su propia casa y adquirir un terreno.
texts.en:
Bernabé lives with his common-law wife and does not have children.  He does not have any relatives living abroad.  He grows staple crops such as corn and beans, and he has been doing this since he was thirty years old.  He learned to farm from his parents, and he works every day from 6 am to 3 pm.  He has not faced any major difficulties.

He is seeking this loan in order to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and other items.  This investment will help him to protect his crops as necessary.

His dream is to build his own home and acquire a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and other items.

loans.name: Djiguisseme  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAMPOGOSSO, un des villages de la commune de  kimparana, cercle de SAN, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5 eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  BINTOU DRAMANE,  1 ère femme  assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called  DJIGUISSEME 3 are married women with an average age of 39 and 6 children, all living in traditional families in Kampogosso, one of the villages of the community of Kimparana, administrative circle of San, fourth administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, their prior loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Bintou Dramane, the first woman sitting left to right in the photo cultivates peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy inputs, seeds and tools, and pay plowing fees to maintain one and a half hectares. Her produce is sold in the village and  in Kimparana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 110,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season. 

This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, buying farm inputs, agricultural tools, and seeds.

loans.name: Djiguisseme  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAMPOGOSSO, un des villages de la commune de  Kimparana cercle de SAN, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4er prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec MINESSA ,  1 ère femme débout de la gauche vers la droite en complet wax couleur ancre  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 95 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Djiguisseme 4 are married women who average 42 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in KAMPOGOSSO, a village of the commune of Kimparana, in the circle of SAN, 4th administrative region of Mali.

They partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th loan cycle with the MFI, and all past loans were correctly repaid. 

Minessa grows groundnuts. She appears in the photo standing first from the left, wearing an ink-coloured wax pagne. She will use her loan to buy inputs, seeds and small farming equipment, and to pay for the cost of plowing 0.5 hectare of farmland.

After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the village and in Kimparana to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Minessa expects to earn a profit of 95,500FCFA by the end of the season. This will help her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds and small farming equipment, and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Yovany

texts.es:
Yovany tiene 36 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Yovany se dedica a  la costura, actividad que aprendió desde muy joven, estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Empezó instalando su propio taller en su casa con una sola maquina que compró con sus ahorros, ahora cuenta con 3 maquinas. Lleva en éste oficio hace más de 09  años, a veces cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana.
Le gusta su actividad el poder contar con un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos del hogar. Desea poder ampliar su negocio y comprar una maquina semindustrial. Este es el  segundo préstamo con Kiva, está contenta de saber que cuenta con un  apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes, por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el  pago de sus cuotas. Con  el monto de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de materiales  para costura como telas, hilos, elásticas, botones, etc.
texts.en: Yovany is 36 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. Yovany is a seamstress, an activity she learned at a young age, studying in an occupational education center. She began by opening her own shop in her house with only one machine that she bought with her savings, and now she has 3 machines. She has been working as a seamstress for 9 years, at times with the help of her sister. She likes that with her job she can count on an income with which to pay the household expenses. She wishes to be able to expand her business and buy a semi-industrial machine. This is her second loan with Kiva; she is content to know that she can depend on the financial support to solidify her plans, therefore she promises to be responsible with her payments. With the 2000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buy sewing materials such as fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Gracias al buen empleo que Francisco le dio al crédito de kiva pudo comprar fertilizante y pagar a los jornaleros que le ayudaron a mejorar su finca y con ello en la cosecha pasada obtuvo mejores resultados. en esta ocasión Francisco pide un crédito para comprar planta para reforestar parte de su finca ya que tiene algunas matas viejas que ya no tienen buena producción y quiere renovarlas con  nuevas y así en 3 años su producción aumentara considerablemente y con ello tendrá mejores ganancias económicas que le ayudaran a realizar su sueño que es apoyar a sus hijos a que tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Thanks to Francisco's hard work, he obtained a Kiva loan and was able to purchase fertilizer and pay laborers who helped him to improve his field of coffee bushes.  As a result, he obtained better results in the most recent harvest.

Currently he his seeking a loan in order to purchase seedlings in order to replant part of his field, since he has some older bushes that are no longer producing well.  He wants to replace these with new plants, and in so doing, his production will grow considerably in the next three years.  He will then have greater profits, which will help him to realize his dream, which is to support his children and give them the opportunity for a college education.

loans.use: to purchase coffee seedlings in order to replant part of his field, as well as fertilizer to augment his production.

loans.name: Los Garci Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellos es Mayra mujer de 29 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos de 8 y 3 años. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, comida y nacatamales desde hace 3 años. Tiene 10 años de ser cliente de la institución. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para los nacatamales como es quintal de maíz, hojas, mecates,  matanza y venta de cerdo. Juan hombre de 34 años de edad, su negocio es artesano de canasto y Manuel tiene 50 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising partners.  One of these is Mayra, a 29 year old woman in a committed relationship with two children aged 8 and 3.  Her business of three years is clothing, food, and nacatamales [a special kind of tamale] sales.  

She has been a client of this institution for ten years.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of raw materials for nacatamales like a quintal [~100 pounds] of maize, leaves, twine, and pork.   

Juan is a 34-year-old man whose business is artisan baskets, and Manuel is a 50-year-old man whose business is a grocery.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials for nacatamales like a quintal of maize, leaves, twine, and pork.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
CARMEN tiene 32 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Solicita el crédito para comprar herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la agricultura.
Lás compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es Tener un regadio propio para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar reuniones familiares.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years old, single, and lives with her two children in the Cantón Ventanas province of los Ríos.

She is a member of the VRC la CHONTA, which is located in la Chonta area, belonging to the Cantón Ventanas area where there is agricultural and livestock work. 

Carmen grows corn and rice. She seeks a loan to buy herbicides, fertilizers, and manure. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs to farm. She will make the purchases in Ventanas.

Her dream is to have her own irrigation for her crops. In her free time she enjoys gathering with friends.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: jose vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,jose esta solictando un credito para comprar los insumos necesarios como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar
texts.en:
Jose lives in his own house with his family.  He has been farming for several years.  His main crops are corn and sorghum.  When his harvest is ready, he sells it at the different markets that are close to where he lives.  With the earnings that he gets from his sales, he manages to cover some of the household expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy some needed supplies like compost, pesticides, seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers, etc.  He hopes to have favorable results because he does not have another source of income.  He trusts in God that he will manage to get an abundant harvest, which will allow him to continue bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe Uno Group

texts.en:
“Guadalupe Uno” is the name of a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank located in Cantel, Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. The group consists of eleven members whose average age is 34. They each have an average of five children. Most of the women work in the textile business and produce beautiful pieces of embroidery which they fabricate by hand and machine. One of the ladies owns a small shop where she sells items for daily consumption while another sells food.

Miriam is a 48-year-old member of the Trust Bank; she joined three years ago. She is married to a tailor and has five daughters. Miriam sells snacks and other food. She is requesting a new loan of $641, which she will use to purchase a stove and a gas cylinder, a meat processor, and a blender. These items are very necessary for the success of her business. She rents a space for her business, and sells four days each week. Miriam’s dream is to own her own space for her growing business. She points out that her previous loans have helped her maintain and increase her business.

The women of the Trust Bank “Guadalupe Uno” are happy to have created such a circle of support, and they enjoy the monthly training given by Friendship Bridge. They learn about business administration, money management, marketing, and women’s health. They are very active and like to participate during these trainings and respect everyone’s opinion. The women of “Guadalupe Uno” would like to take this opportunity to thank the support of KIVA investors. They are most appreciative of the confidence that the investors have in the women’s ability to improve their own lives. It is through these loans that the women will receive much needed working capital for their small businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a stove, a meat processor and a blender.

loans.name: Dinora Estela

texts.es: Dinora de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, sandias, elotes, guineos, etc. entre otros, tiene 15 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Dinora es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. dinora tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Dinora, 42, lives in her own home with her husband and her three children. She works selling fruits and vegetables like strawberries, bananas, oranges, watermelons, corn, guineos (green bananas) and more. She has been in this business for 15 years and this has given her a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to earn more income. The location where she sells is very strategic for the business and it is also well-trafficked. She has lots of customers who prefer her because her product is fresh, a good price, quality, and her service is excellent. Dinora is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work with a great will to move forward. She is always looking for alternatives to allow her to achieve success. In recent weeks, demand increased and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment. But she does not have enough capital to back her, so she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables. Dinora has good payment references. She is grateful for the work and is confident she will be able to pay off the loan. She is also confident that this will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables like strawberries, bananas, oranges, watermelons, corn, guineos (green bananas) and more

loans.name: Weniger

texts.es: Weniger tiene 37 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junto su esposa y su hijo de 8 años. Weniger se dedica a construcciones de casa y electrificar las mismas, lleva realizando este trabajo por 06 años solo, pero aprendió esta actividad trabajando por otras personas. Le está yendo muy bien, tiene muchos contratos y siempre realiza su trabajo de buena manera y con todos los implementas de seguridad necesarios. Desea seguir trabajando e implementándose  con herramientas y equipos que le permitan realizar su trabajo con mayor rapidez. Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, además el se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos. Con el monto de 2000 soles, comprará materiales, herramienta y equipos que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Weniger is thirty-seven years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their eight-year-old son. Weniger builds houses and also installs electrical wiring in homes. He has been doing this work on his own for six years, but he learned this trade while working for other people. Things are going very well - he has many contracts, and he always does good work and ensures that proper safety procedures are followed. Going forward, he wants to use tools and equipment that will enable him to do his work more quickly. This will be his fourth loan through Kiva. He is very happy to know that he will have financial support, since this will allow him to feel secure in expanding his business. He promises to be punctual in his loan repayments. He his seeking 2,000 nuevos soles in order to buy materials, tools and equipment that he needs in order to continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment so he can continue his construction projects.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris con 35 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, ama de casa y agricultora desde hace muchos años con 6 años de educación. En compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedican a la agricultura, siembra y cultivo de café actividad practicada en su familia por generaciones y medio de ingreso económico para el sustento. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto con calidad e higiene. Como todo ella encuentra desafíos los cuales son los cambios climáticos, la baja de precio de café en el mercado, las plagas y enfermedades que lo deterioren.

Pero para evitar eso ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL con el cual ella podrá comprar formula cafetalera, abono, urea entre otros insumos que ayudaran al cultivo a mantenerse sano de plagas, de heladas en los diferentes cambios climáticos y protegido de enfermedades como la roya.

Sus planes son que con las ganancias ella pueda reinvertir y ampliar más sus cultivos de café sembrar más y mejorar y hacer más atractiva su cosecha para generar ingresos y darles a sus hijos un mejor estilo y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Doris is the mother of five children, the head of her household, and has been a farmer for many years with her six years of education.  She and her partner work in farming, growing coffee, which has been a family business for generations and which is their means of financial support.  Her customers are different buyers that come to the area looking for clean, quality produce.  Like everyone, she faces challenges, such as changes in climate, the low market price of coffee, pests, and deteriorating diseases.

However, to avoid these she has asked COMIXMUL for a loan with which she will be able to buy coffee-growing formula, fertilizer, and urea, among other supplies that will help keep her crops free of pests, safe from freezes in weather changes, and protected from diseases such as rust.

Her plans are to reinvest her profits and to expand her coffee plantings, to plant more and better and to make her harvest more attractive to generate income and give her children a better way and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia. Ella, se dedica a la venta de lácteos para obtener ingresos favorables y ayudar a su  familia.
El prestamo que requiere  le permitirá comprar marqueta de queso, crema, entre otros; esto le proporcionara más productivos sus ingresos y la estabilidad económica.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: María lives with her family.  She works selling dairy products to earn good income and help her family.  The loan she needs will make it possible for her to buy cheese molds and cream, among others.  This will lead to higher income and economic stability.  Her dream is to provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, etc.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es:
José, vive con sus padres, su padre de 60 años de edad y su madre de 62 años, todos trabajan juntos en el negocio para salir adelante. El, se dedica a la fabricación de toldos, lo realiza desde hace más de 25 años y lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a  7:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar tela, nailon, tubos de hierro de 2 pulgadas y media, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a terminar de hacer un trabajo pendiente de la alcaldía aledaña a su negocio.
Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: José lives with his parents, his father, 60 years old, and his mother, 62 years old. They all work together in the business to move forward. He works manufacturing awnings, which he has done for more than 25 years, and he does every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. The loan he is asking for will allow him to buy fabric, nylon, and two-and-a-half-inch iron tubes, among other things. This investment will help him to finish up a pending job for a nearby community by his business. His dream is to finish building his house and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, nylon, and two-and-a-half-inch iron tubes, among other things.

loans.name: Patricia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña patricia es originaria de León, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, tiene a cargo dos persona. Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la actividad de pulpería hace tres años, es licenciada en ciencia social. En su negocio la apoyan sus hijos, tiene como otra fuente de ingreso su jubilación. Solicita este préstamo para comprar arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite y huevos. Este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que al invertir, obtendrá mayor ganancia. Su plan futuro es tener su propia línea de cosméticos y su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en: Patricia is originally from León, is 49 years old, single, has 5 children, and is responsible for 2 people. She is a merchant selling groceries for three years. She has a degree in social science. Her children support her with her business, and she also has her retirement income as another income source. She seeks a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, and eggs. This loan will be of great help because upon the investment, she will be able to have greater earnings. Her future plans are having her own line of cosmetics and her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por cuatros  socios uno de ellos es Bismar hombre de 45 años de edad, soltero, tiene dos hijos de 24 y 9 años de edad. Su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace 8 años. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 7 años. Este  crédito lo invertirá en comprar por paca los pantalones y camisas  para vender. Yamir tiene 27 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas, Ana mujer de 24 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y Patricia tiene 32 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada
texts.en:
The group is made up of four members, one of whom is Bismar. He is 45 years old and single with two children, ages 24 and 9. His business has been selling clothing for more than eight years. He has been a client of the institution for seven years. He will invest this loan in buying bundles of pants and shirts to sell. 

Yamir is 27 and his business is selling fruits. Ana is 24 and her business is selling used clothing. Patricia is 32 and she sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing like pants and shirts in bundles.

loans.name: Los Aguacatales Group

texts.es:
Mario (al centro de la fotografía) es el representante del Grupo Los Aguacatales, es un  hombre soltero de  42 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos (3 hombres y 3 mujeres)en el Caserío Maya Cakchiquel, Cantón El Tablón, Sololá. 
El es un hombre trabajador y amable, se dedica a la agricultura y específicamente a la producción de maíz. Tiene 20 años de estar realizando esta actividad, la cual es una actividad de mucha importancia para él debido a que a través de la misma asegura la alimentación de su familia y el excedentes de producción lo vende en el mercado local, lo que a la vez le genera ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades como ropa y educación de sus hijos.
Los demás integrantes del grupo utilizarán este crédito para la compra de abono orgánico para el mantenimiento de maíz, con el  propósito de mejorar la calidad y cantidad de producción. 
El sueño de Mario es remodelar su vivienda y también brindarle educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario (pictured in the center) is the representative of the Aguatacales Group. He is 42 years old, who lives together with his children (three sons and three daughters) in Caserio Maya Cakchiquel, in the canton of El Tablón, in the province of Sololá.

He is a kind and hardworking man who works as a farmer growing corn. He has been working as a farmer for 20 years, an occupation that is very important to him as it is how he ensures he can provide for his family. He sells his surplus harvest in the local markets, which generates additional income for covering household expenses such as clothing and education for his children. The other members of the group will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizer to maintain their corn crop and thus the quality and yield of their harvest.

Mario's goal is to remodel his home and provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Albertina De Jesús

texts.es:
Albertina tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. se ha dedicado siempre a los oficios del hogar, pero es una persona que necesita mejorar su vivienda, ya que sus familiares como su  esposo y  sus dos hijos le ayudaran a pagar la deuda. actualmente vive junto a un hijo nada mas en la casa, anteriormente ella viajaba hacia los estados unidos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra, para terminar de construir su casa, específicamente la cocina; ya que se ha quedado sin dinero para continuar la construcción ya que inicio la época de invierno y no quiere que se le vayan a deteriorar sus cosas.

Ella comenta que estará satisfecha cuando tenga un hogar digno, y con espacio necesario para su familia; ya que tendrá el lugar adecuado de su cocina y así preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Albertina, 48, is married with two children.   She’s always done household chores but needs to improve her house and her family members like her husband and two children will help her repay the loan.  She currently lives with just one son at home; she used to travel to the United States.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy building materials and to pay labor costs to finish building her house, specifically the kitchen, because she’s run out of money to continue the construction because it’s winter and she doesn’t want her things to be damaged.

She comments that she’ll be satisfied when she has a proper home with the required space for her family and a kitchen that’s adequate for preparing meals.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Piedad De Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO PIEDAD DE DIOS
Este dúo está conformado por Felisa es originaria de Sumpango Sac ella es madre de familia y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de refacciones, todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para la venta y siempre aprovecha las mañanas para vender desayunos, cuenta que el negocio ha sido muy rentable a pesar de las dificultades que ha tenido con el clima ya que en las madrugadas es la hora que vende,pero eso no ha sido un inpedimento para que ella siga luchando en su negocio Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito esta contenta porque en el primer credito estubo puntual en sus pagos y le da gracias a Dios por no dejarla caer en mora y le pide a Dios para que nuevamente este puntual en sus pagos y siempre esperando la ayuda de ustedes a traves del credito solicitado, además agradece a kiva por la oportunidad que le brindo en el primer credito.
texts.en:
Piedad de Dios Duo Solidario (God's Mercy Solidarity Partnership)

This partnership was set up by Felisa, who is from Sumpango Sac. She is a mother and, as a job, she makes and sells refreshments.  She gets up very early every day to prepare food for sale.  She always takes advantage of mornings to sell breakfast.  She tells us that the business has been very profitable in spite of the difficulties she has had with the climate because it is in the early morning that they sell their food.  This has not, however, stopped her from striving in her business. It is the second time that they have applied for a loan.  She is happy because she made her repayments for her first loan punctually, is thankful to God for not letting her get into arrears and prays that he will help her to pay punctually this time, too.  She always hopes to receive your help in the form of the loan she has applied for and is also thankful to Kiva for the opportunity they granted her by awarding the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for making the refreshments which they sell

loans.name: Mayli Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Mayli Cecilia de 27 años de edad, ella se dedica a la confección de playeras en diferentes colores, tamaños y estilos.  Lleva 5 años en el negocio ya que le a servido para sacar adelante y así luchar por sus dos hijos que aun están pequeños.  Su sueño sigue siendo ser una gran confeccionista de playeras, reconocida en otros países, y algún día exportar su mercadería.  Tiene varios clientes que le han hecho varios pedidos pero la tela que tiene no le alcanza y se ve en la necesidad de pedir un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar los rollos de tela que le hacen falta para poder sacar los pedidos que le han hecho, y así no fallarle a las personas que esperan una buena respuesta de ella les agradece por la ayuda que le han brindado por medio de los creditos que Dios los bendiga donde quiera que esten.
texts.en: Mayli Cecilia, who is 27, makes t-shirts in a range of different colours, sizes and styles.  She has worked in this business for 5 years and has achieved success. As a result, she does everything she can for her two young children.  She still has the same dream: to be a leading and internationally recognised t-shirt producer and to be able to export her goods one day.  Mayli has a number of customers who have ordered goods from her, but the fabric she has is not sufficient.  Therefore, she has to apply for a new loan to buy the rolls of fabric she needs to meet these orders and avoid letting down the people who expect her to come up with the goods.  She thanks you for the help which you have provided in the form of loans and wishes you God's blessing wherever you may be.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make and sell men's (beach) clothing

loans.name: Famatu

texts.en:
Famatu is married and has seven children between the ages of 20 and 5 years old. Only six of her children are in school and they all live together in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.

For the past seven years Famatu has been selling rice by cup and red oil at the local market. She completed 6th grade before starting her business. She described herself as a hard working woman. She spends 10 hours a day on her business. She likes her business because she makes more profits. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Most of the time she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her table.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by bag and red oil for her business. Famatu's plans are to build a house and educate all of her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by bag and red oil for her business.

loans.name: Dúo  Solidario Herencia Del Rey Group

texts.es: Duo Solidario Herencia del Rey, integrado por la señorita Hilda de 30 años soltera,ella tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 3 años, ella hace cortes, cepillados, peinados, bases,  alisados permanentes, tientes,  limpieza  facial, atiende todos los días y tiene su clientela segura, también trabaja a domicilio ya sea una ocasión especial o solamente necesitan su servicio, también Como actividad secundaria vende productos medicinales en su mismo local.y asi aumentar su clientela y variedad en su negocio,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para el salon e belleza espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que es una bonita oportunidad para crecer un poco mas y que mejor que sea con la ayuda de kiva, desde ya les agradese por su ayuda.
texts.en:
Miss Hilda, age 30 and single, is part of Duo Solidario Herencia del Rey. She has had a beauty salon for 3 years. She does cuts, brushing, styling, base coloring, permanent straightening, dyeing, and facials. She works every day and has regular clients. She also goes to people's homes if it is a special occasion or they need her services. As well, as a secondary activity she sells medicinal products from her shop. 

Now she is seeking a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon. She hopes that you can help her with this loan as it is a good opportunity to grow a little more and even better if it is with Kiva's help. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for a beauty salon

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 66 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo, sus 2 hijos, y sus nietos. Rosa se dedica a la venta de refrescantes gaseosas, pero principalmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y artículos de perfumería y arreglo personal. Vende a vecinos en su barrio, y también desde su casa. La venta de gaseosas lo hace con ayuda de sus nietos. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite estar todo el día en constante actividad. Se siente útil y con mucha energía para continuar trabajando por el bien de su familia, ahora tiene muchos planes de mejorar su negocio. Este será el cuarto préstamo con Kiva, espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará productos de perfumería y cuidado personal como cremas, talcos, y cosméticos variados, para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 66 years old, married, and lives in her own house with her husband, their two children, and their grandchildren. Rosa makes a living selling sodas, but principally makes a living selling cosmetics, perfume, and personal hygiene products. She sells to neighbors and also from her house. 

She sells sodas with the help of her grandchildren. She really likes what she does, since it allows her to be in constant activity all day. She feels useful and with much energy to continue working for the good of her family. Now she has many plans to improve her business. This will be the fourth loan with Kiva. She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives. 

With the amount of 1200 nuevos soles, she will buy perfume and personal hygiene products like creams, talcum power, and various cosmetics, to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy creams, talcum power, and cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu operates a business of selling makuti (palm leaves) for construction purposes, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality: business is especially slow during the rainy season. 

With the 50,000 KES Mesalimu wants to purchase more palm leaves for roofing and mangrove trees for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for house roofing and mangrove trees for her business

loans.name: Abe

texts.en:
Abe is a 47-year-old woman who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She did not attend school but she said she is good at managing her home and business affairs. She is single with five children between ages 28 and 14, only three of whom are attending school and they all live at home.

For the past fifteen years, Abe has been selling rice, oil, coal, cold water etc. in the local market. The problem she faces is that sometimes buying goes slow, but most of the time she makes a profit, which she uses to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, coal, cold water etc. for her business. Abe hopes to build a house in the near future. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, coal, cold water etc. for her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, a place rich in natural resources and where the living conditions are much better than in the capital city. It is the second most populous county in Liberia.

Oretha completed six grades, and she has lived in a rural area all of her life. Traditionally she is married and her husband is a farmer: they both have six children. Her children are between 21 and 27 years old.

With the little money she received from her mother, Oretha was able to establish her business eight years ago by running a table where she sells palm oil, Vita and peppers. She spends nine hours a day on her business and faces no other problems except for few goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, Vita, and peppers for her business. Her plan is to one day move from the table business to a shop. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, Vita, and peppers for her business.

loans.name: Tawiah's Group

texts.en:
Tawiah is 63 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Teshie, Accra, Ghana. Both of her daughters are in the area and are still in school. Tawiah sells smoked fish, while her husband works as a carpenter to supplement the family’s income. In the photo she is standing on the extreme right.

Tawiah's business earns her family a daily income of about 80 GHS; she is able to save 10 GHS each week.

This is the fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana for Tawiah’s group, and they have repaid back previous loans without trouble. This is Tawiah's second loan with Kiva and she was successful repaying her first loan, which enabled her to support her family with enough food. 

She is now leading this group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more smoked fish to sell to customers. The other members of the group sell mineral drinks and firewood.

Tawiah hopes to earn more income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Velasquez Jimenez Group

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Roberto es soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, curso 4 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maíz, inició este negocio con su padres y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con todo el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de insumos para agricultura tales como: fertilizante y semillas, desea en el futuro contar con un capital amplio para poder sembrar mas maíz y asi poder generar mejores ganancias. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siemnra de maíz.
En la fotografía aparecen 10 integrantes pero, solamente a 9 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Edgar Roberto is single and is 26 years old.  He has a 4th grade education.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn. He started this business with his parents, and up until now he has 5 years of experience.  He has the full support of his family.

Edgar is organizing a group and requesting a loan that he will use to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.  In the future, he wants to have more capital so that he can plant more corn and thereby generate higher earnings.  

The other members of this group cultivate corn.  In the photograph 10 members appear, but only 9 of them are taking this loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 42 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y su hijo de 14 años. Norma se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. La  preparación la realiza en su casa y vende las comidas afuera de la casa. Realiza esta actividad sola. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y logra terminar todos sus productos. Decidió a empezar con esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional para apoyar a su esposo. Está viendo los buenos resultados que tiene en su negocio, desea en un futuro abrir un negocio de un restaurante pues le gusta cocinar. Éste será el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Norma is 42 years old, married and lives in her own home with her husband and 14 year old son. Norma sells regional foods. She prepares it at home and sells it outside her house. She does this by herself. She feels her business is quite good as she manages to sell all her product and is left with a profit. Norma decided to start this business as it was necessary to have an additional income to support her husband. Seeing the positive results from her business, she would like to open a restaurant in the future, as she likes to cook.

This will be her second loan with Kiva. She is happy she can count on this support to advance her business. She will invest the 800 PEN ($300) to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice and oil to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is a single woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs such as maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo would like to apply for another KES 50,000 loan to purchase chicken feed and more chicks. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo  para adquirir más productos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar sandalias para damas y caballeros, asimismo otro tipo de productos.
El crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que logro surtir más el negocio y mejoro así las ventas de su negocio, por lo que ha obtenido mayores ingresos. Su sueño es tener su propio local  y agregar otro tipo de productos para brindarles una mejor calidad  de vida  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra needs to opt for a new loan in order to acquire more products. This investment will help her buy sandals for women and men, as well as other types of products.

Her previous loan was favorable, as she was able to better stock her business and improved her sales, resulting in obtaining higher income. Her dream is to have her own locale and add other types of products in order to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy sandals for women and men as well as other types of products.

loans.name: Chisungo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Sithembile from Mutare. She is a single parent with three children, and two are attending school.  

Sithembile runs a retail business, selling electrical goods (televisions, stoves and fridges) and clothes. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of late payments from clients who buy on credit. 

Sithembile has requested a loan of $500 to buy televisions and cellphones for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. 

In the future, Sithembile plans to build her own shop.

loans.use: to import electrical goods like televisions, stoves, fridges and cellphones from South Africa and Botswana for resale.

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
LUIS tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con el suegro con los hijos y la conyugue.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es trabajar mucho para incrementar los ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir con la familia y disfrutar.
texts.en:
Luis is 39 years old. He and his partner have three children, and the family lives with Luis's father-in-law.

He is a member of the La Chonta village bank in the village of La Chonta near the town of Ventanas. The members farm and raise cattle.

Luis grows corn and soybeans. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. This loan will allow him to buy the things he needs for his farming. 

He will make his purchases in Ventanas. He hopes to work hard and increase his earnings. In his free time, he likes to go out with his family and have a good time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 42 years old and she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and where the living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populous county in Liberia.

Lucy stopped her education at 4th grade and she grew up in the rural areas of Sanniquelle. She is traditionally married: her husband is a farmer and they both have seven children. Her children are between ages 19  and 16. She said that three of her children are in school and they all live at home.

Lucy received a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business seven years ago; she has been running a small local shop where she makes and sells local soap, palm oil etc., she spends 10 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is low income. She will use the loan to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic soda, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic soda, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a green grocery selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality of products, hence reducing the sales. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a 27-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be humble and respectful. 

She operates a beauty salon where she does hairdressing, hair plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are women. 

Charlotte will use the KES 40,000 loan to add stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other beauty salon items. 

Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will settle down. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other beauty salon items.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children, ages 3 years and 6 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years.
