Her business is located near a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough finances to boost her business.

Beatrice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for resale. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and repay the loan.

loans.use: buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Kelly se dedica a la venta de comida, también prepare refrescos con frutas naturales, brinda siempre un trato amable, y una buena sazón. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 04 años. Empezó siendo ayudante de su madre quien ahora le dio el control total del negocio. Además de trabajar también esta  estudiando y tiene que darse tiempo para dedicarse a sus estudios. Anteriormente vendía jugos y panes durante las mañanas pero tuvo que cambiar de actividad debido a la importancia que representa para ella forjarse una carrera académica. Le gustaría mucho poder agrandar su negocio y poner más mesas, sillas e implementarlo con algunos utensilios. Esto será su séptimo préstamo con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que le brinda un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de ingredientes como arroz, pollo, aceite, y frutas, además de otros artículos como  sillas y otros utensilios.
texts.en: Kelly is 21 years old, single, lives with her parents, sells food and also makes soft drinks with natural fruits.  She always provides friendly service, good seasoning, and has been working this way for four years, having started out helping her mother who has since given her control of the business.  Aside from working, she also studies and must set aside time.  She used to sell juices and bread in the morning, but she had to change because it was important to her to focus on her studies.  She would very much like to grow her business and set up tables and chairs and some utensils.  This will be her seventh loan through Kiva and she is happy to know that she has financial support so she can continue advancing her business.  She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy ingredients such as rice, chicken, cooking oil, and fruit, along with other items such as chairs and other utensils.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en: Patima is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives in the capital city of Georgia with her husband Avtandil and son George. Avtandil is unemployed. In this region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  Patima works as a tailor from home. She gets orders to sew different types of clothing for men and woman. Her income is not enough for the three-member family, so she decided to start a business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Patima’s credit requests were rejected several times since she didn't satisfy their requirements. She received her loan in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $3,000, Patima will open a household goods shop. She will rent a commercial space and stock of goods. Avtandil will work with her in the shop. The new business initiative will give the family a chance to have a stable income along with the orders she gets from her customers to sew clothes.

loans.use: to start trading household goods

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus dos hijas en su casa propia. Lourdes se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene sembríos de papa, maíz, habas, trigo, cebada y pastizales, el cual le sirve de alimento para su ganado. Con su familia se ha propuesto mejorar cada año y superar su producción agrícola y ganadera, ya que su secreto es comercializar los alimentos en otra ciudad. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Lourdes, invertirá los S/.1800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en: Lourdes is 46 years old and is a hard-working woman. She lives with her two daughters in their house. Lourdes works in agriculture and cattle-rearing and grows potato, corn, beans, wheat, barley, and pasture which she uses to feed her cattle. She and her family have set themselves the goal of improving every year and increasing their agricultural and cattle production so they can sell the food in other cities. This is Lourdes's fourth loan from Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives from them which allows her to get on in life. She also pledges to make timely repayments. Lourdes will invest 1800 soles to buy organic manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married, and has children. She has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a brick-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality of products, hence reducing the sales. 

With the KSH 45,000, she wants to purchase more sacks of bricks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of bricks for resale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with two children and both her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last four years. She works six days a week. She has no other source of income. She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy a bale of second hand shoes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and but does not have access to piped water.  Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Delfino Silvestre

texts.en: Delfino is a dairy producer from Mexico State looking to improve the financial viability of his farm. He earns very little from his milk production and is looking to decrease operating costs. By investing in his 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to decrease spending on energy by displacing non-renewable LP gas with clean, renewable biogas generated using the manure produced by his dairy cows. Concurrently, he will reduce the environmental impact of his farm through better waste management and reduced greenhouse gas emissions. This loan represents 45% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: semilla, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y pago de mozos.
El préstamo anterior fue favorable, ya que logro cumplir con lo que necesitaba la cosecha y logro obtener una excelente producción, la familia se ha mantenido. Hoy en día ya cuenta con energía eléctrica propia, asimismo construyo una nueva casa y ha agregado otro tipo de actividad.
texts.en: Hector has decided that it is necessary for him to request a new loan because he needs money to help him buy the agricultural supplies he needs such as seeds, manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and to pay labor costs. The previous loan was of great help to him as it covered the costs of the things he needed for the harvest and he managed to obtain an excellent crop and this allowed him to provide for his family. He now has electricity at home, has built another house, and has found other sources of work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 34 years old. She lives in a rented house with her eight-year-old son, whom she says wants to be a pilot when he grows up. Jean runs her own Zoona money transfer shops in the Kazungula and Kalomo towns of Zambia. Her business enables people to send and receive monies to and from their families and friends throughout the country. She says providing this service to people helps her pay for her rentals and son’s school fees.

Jean started running her Zoona money transfer business six months ago. Business is good and she says the one thing holding her back is that she does not have enough working capital to serve her customers at the desired time. She says this makes her panic sometimes because she constantly has to run up and down trying to find some money.  As a micro-entrepreneur, Jean has found it very difficult to source working capital. She explains that she had gotten a loan from a Micro lending institution but the interest was too high and it almost collapsed her business. Jean is taking out this loan so that she can increase her working capital and grow her business by serving more customers. “This Kiva loan is the only chance I have to grow my business and am grateful for this lifetime opportunity’’ Jean says.

Jean has high hopes for her future. Her face brightens when she explains that her biggest dream is to see her business grow so that she can put her son through college and build her own house from the profits.

loans.use: To increase her working capital to send and receive large amounts of monies

loans.name: Layvah

texts.en:
Layvah lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia.

Layvah is 40 years old. She did not go to school, and she is unmarried. She has a 20-year-old child who lives at home. With a little money from her fiancee, who works with WFP, she managed to establish her business three years ago. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends 10 hours [a day] on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernan nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta hermosa ciudad, él tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos a quienes saca adelante, él se dedica a la venta de carne de cordero, res, pollo, vacuno y porcino, él tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y el puesto de venta esta implementado con la necesidad básicas, él administra su negocio y a tiende a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar al puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Hernan was born in Paucartambo city in Cusco department and lives together with his family in this beautiful city. He is 30 years old and has a long-term partner with whom he has four children who he does his best to provide for. He sells lamb, beef, chicken, and pork from a small stall that he has in one of the markets in Paucartambo. His stall is fitted with everything he needs for his business. He runs his business by himself, serving his relatives, neighbors and friends in a friendly and polite way which makes them keep returning to buy from him. He has been working in this area for several years and his business is successful due to his hard work. He is part of the Mamacha Carmen communal bank and, this time, he requires the loan to buy meat. He is grateful for the loan and is deeply committed to making the monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She does not have additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last six years. She works six days a week. Her other source of income is from selling piped water from home. She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 700,000 UGX to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration are to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity .Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a watch repair shop, where he repairs watches and also sells watches. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to expand his business by buying more watches to sell and other repair materials. His business goal is to have a self-sustaining business within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more watches to sell and other repair materials

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 26-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a clothes store where she sells dresses and makes dresses. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Jeannette De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Jeannette, se decide  por un nuevo préstamo para adquirir equipo para realizar mejor sus operaciones; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar una maquina industrial y una mesa de 2 x 2 metros, asimismo artículos para la costureria.
 El préstamo anterior le sirvió de manera positiva para el fortalecimiento del negocio y a tener en este tiempo, ya un taller establecido, las condiciones económicas se mantienen estables y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado debido  que tiene una fuente estable de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jeannette decided to apply for a new loan to get equipment to be able to improve her operations. This investment will help her to buy an industrial sewing machine and a table that is 2 meters by 2 meters, as well as sewing items.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business and to already have an established workshop. Her economic condition has remained stable and her family circumstances have improved thanks to her having a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and a table that is 2 meters x 2 meters, as well as sewing items.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu was born in 1979 and she has been living in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and the living condition is much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She stopped her education at ninth grade and described herself as businesswoman. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have seven children between 21 and 2 years old.  Only six of her children are in school and live at home. From selling her husband's farm products, she was able to establish her business six years ago by been running a table where she sells dried bush meat. She spends 10 hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried meat for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more dried meat for her business.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.en: Lisbeth is a 31-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a clothes store where she sells dresses. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase stock of dresses for resale. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase dresses for resale

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
FAUSTO  tiene 49 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Fausto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertiliznates, herbicidas, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.

El sueño es comprar terrenos y un regadío para los cultivos.
texts.en:
Fausto is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children in La Chonta, Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He is a member of La Chonta communal bank. This area is dedicated to agricultural and livestock raising.

Fausto is a farmer, who grows corn and soya. He needs this loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide and manure. With the help of this loan he can buy all that he needs for farming. His dream is to buy land and irrigation for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and manure.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta is 36 years old. She lives Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She did not go to school and she has lived all her life in a rural area, Traditionally, she is married and her husband is a farmer. They have three children between 16 to 8 years old who are in school and live at home. With a little money from her mother, she was able to establish her business. Since 2006, she has been running a small local shop where she sells artificial hair. She spends nine hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 45 años es una mujer alegre. Tiene 3 hijos, pero solo vive con una de ellas en la casa que compró hace 6 años. Olga se dedica a cultivar papa, maíz y alfalfa el cual le sirve para alimentar a sus animales, ya que tiene vacas y ovejas los cuales son vendidos a los pobladores de su localidad , lo cual le genera más ingresos económicos. Pero como es muy trabajadora, también trabaja embolsando carne de pollo en una empresa de su ciudad, está actividad la realiza dos veces por semana, pues tiene que cuidar de sus animales  y sus porductos agrícolas. Ahora se ha trazado metas concretas para  seguir creciendo. Y está segura de lograrlo.
Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Olga, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Olga is a happy 45-year-old woman. She has 3 children, but she only lives with one of them in a house that she bought 6 years ago. Olga grows potatoes, corn, and alfalfa, which she serves to her animals. She has cows and sheep that she sells to the people in her town. This way, she generates more economic income. But since she is very hardworking, she also works packaging chicken at a business in her city. She does this activity two times a week, since she also has to care for her animals and her agricultural products. Now she has set specific goals to continue growing. And she is sure to achieve them.

This is her fourth loan with KIVA and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue moving forward. She promises to pay her bills on time. Olga will use the 1000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish their crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 64 años de edad, está divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto su hija y sus nietos. Nelly se dedica a la costura y confección de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, contando un pequeño taller que instaló en su casa, Tiene más de 30 años realizando ésta actividad, contando con la ayuda de una señora. Comenta que  aprendió esta actividad estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, y le ha servido como una fuente de ingreso económico y así sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por eso tiene planes de abrir una boutique en su propia casa, donde pueda exhibir sus productos. Esto será el segundo préstamo  con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a  cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos elásticos y otros.
texts.en: Nelly is 64 years old. She is divorced and lives in her own house with her daughter and her grandchildren. Nelly works sewing and making clothing for women, men, and children. She has a small workshop that she installed in her house. She has been working in this job for more than 30 years with the help of another woman. She says that she learned to sew studying at an occupational education center, and it has been her source of economic income and allowed her to become a productive person.  She considers her business quite profitable because of the good earnings she gets. For this reason, she plans to open a boutique in her own house, where she can display her products.  This will be her second loan with Kiva. She is content to know that she will have financial support, since she will feel secure advancing her business. She promises to complete her payments. With the amount of 1000 soles she will buy sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and elastic, among others.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and elastic, among others.
